rHxFC2KZzqjvYPuksZkCUg.text: Definitely worth it but come hungry.  So glad there is a spot in Charlotte now.  Customer service was great!

8M4sbIRfvtk4JLT6WvNLsA.text: Best experience great food awesome atmosphere will be coming back when we are in the Charlotte area!!

c6MXmbi26MySNOYrm7QbFg.text: This place is awesome for a fun friendly night when you just wanna kick back and hangout with friends. The food is great as well. It's all you can eat, so be ready to bring some  sweatpants lol.  The staff is so welcoming and not so in your face, the atmosphere was very chill and laidback. I'd recommend this spot! All you can eat for 2hrs... I'm in lol!

_X5MZ41dosbMS04yu51Z0A.text: The food here is SO GOOD! I wasn't crazy about the decor and I felt that the restaurant was very loud and echo-ey. It is pricey but great for a splurge and well worth the cost. All of the meats were wonderful- which is a good thing because you are charged for what you don't eat.

Mh3ujBXF3AWIyTyKJfk2gQ.text: EXCELLENT! Come hungry and leave happy! I had the squid, shrimp, red pepper pork belly, bulgogi, spicy chicken and mushrooms. There were other meats I wanted to try, but I was stuffed. The food plus the dining experience was worth the drive from Salisbury.  I would definitely go back.

xbn1ZLHLNxKpUGDDPCQpcw.text: The best Korean BBQ I have been to in a LONG time! I'm from VA/MD area so we are used to seeing a lot of Korean bbq places but Let's Meat by far exceeds my expectations! We loved all the side dishes, dipping sauces, selection of meats and extras and the extremely friendly staff. The service was great and we loved the atmosphere. Honestly I wish we could either move to NC or even better if they would open a location here in the DMV! Try the butter squid it's AMAZING!

BuEe1tN1X-K69Oo-QZaMKA.text: One of our favorite places! We make the 25 minute drive several times a month just for it - please open one in Ballantyne!!

P1gBgMn68Xl9uOpw-n3SNQ.text: WOW! This was probably my favorite Korean BBQ experience EVER! The staff was amazing, they were so attentive and helpful with choosing which meats and sides we wanted. The food was brought to our table INSTANTLY and everyone had a smile on their face! I cannot sing enough praise about this delicious restaurant - we will definitely be back (and soon)! We arrived at 6:30 on Thursday evening and had no wait time but it seemed to get a bit more crowded as the night went on, that however didn't slow service down one bit! 10/10 would recommend! So impressed!!

znJ64ENMzlmYKB-leUqb2g.text: Can't say enough good things about Let's Meat. Let's start with the staff and service: top notch, really exceptional. Our server and everyone else was friendly, prompt, courteous, knowledgeable, and helpful. We were made to feel like valued customers, which is, unfortunately, a rarity and a welcome change. The meats were fresh, the servings generous, and the cuts excellent. We we're given 6 different  sauces, all of which were delicious. The vegetables and side dishes were also fresh and we'll presented. The  dining rooms and rest rooms very immaculate as well. They were quite busy when we arrived and the atmosphere was lively. Can't comment on the beverages as we had water, but the choices were numerous and varied. We had a wonderful dinner and overall experience, can't wait to return.

KVHAs_-2hSoXgqq9jampcw.text: Save your money and go somewhere else. This is not a Korean restaurant! The dishes have korean names but that's where the similarity ends. The side dishes, soups and meats were all below acceptable standards.  The "octopus" was squid.  The "fatty beef" Chadelbagi was tasteless and unrecognizable because of the way it was cut. Bulgogi was far too salty. Mushrooms dry, etc., etc. $30 for all you can eat would usually indicate you can eat it! For $30 you can eat like a king at a real Korean restaurant. My wife is Korean. She rated this the worst Korean food she's ever been served.  I've eaten Korean food all over the the Americas and Asia. Paraquay has better Korean.

rIDOsSe2GbZKQ7OVHy-Q1Q.text: First time here, we walked in(group of 4) and was super busy. We put our name down and when I asked what the wait time was they couldn't give me one, which was annoying but we waited over an hour. Visiting from MD, we have AYCE korean bbq spots everywhere but Let's Meat had a lot of different side options like the cold noodles, bean paste stew, egg souffle, corn cheese and many others. They also have korean drinks like sac sac juice and the orange one. Wish we had one of these in MD!

fvcSDloOaH0ldW6AhbNLYg.text: Really good Korean BBQ, plenty of meat options and like the environment and service. Hope there will be more greens options. Highly recommend.

R47ucZPgUf7yBKItSJ2fDQ.text: Glad to finally have a decent kbbq place in Charlotte. Food options were solid, though deducted a star for no ayce option for kalbi like in other places.   Service is 5 stars though which is a nice change for kbbq (shout out to Green!). They're fast in bringing out your orders and pro active in stopping to see how the table is doing. Nice change of pace compared to many other places.  Glad to have an option I'd be happy to go to without needing to go to Atlanta or DC area.

itoLUOjTBsstOC_OrEnuOg.text: This place is good, but definitely not $30 per person good. We went as a group of 6 and I dont recommend going with more than 4 people, it was difficult to cook on the small cooking surface for that many people. Meat was tasty, and the rice was good. Sauces were just okay, and are on the spicy side. I'm in no way an expert on Korean BBQ so this is just my limited take on the experience. Also, in case you were unaware as we were before we came, there is a 2 hour limit to dining if there is a wait list.

ZE2gpGVFEj6wRGNslY9ruA.text: I have been saying for a few years that Charlotte needed a KBBQ place. Finally, we have one. Everything about my dinner here was good. We got there at 5-515 on a Friday. They will not seat you until everyone in your party arrives. We were waiting on our third person and finally got seated at 530. I recommend going early to catch the first seating or expect a wait. Our server, Alex, was quick to greet us and take our drink orders. She also took our first orders of meet. Somewhere in the she also explained the cooking method and the sides they bring. It's all you can eat with a time limit of 2 hrs. Let's just say, we ate a lot. They will bring whatever you ask for, honestly at one point, I think I had to tap out. The manager come by several times, he even helped cook for us a few times and provided additional instruction. His wife, the owner, also stopped by the table to say hello. They have soju, a variety of flavors which while we didn't try them all, we did several bottles. They are small and like in S. Korea, it's more of shot type thing. All in all, we were there right at 2 hrs, although we stopped eating at probably 1.5 hrs. Overall, based on my handful of KBBQ experiences both in the states and in S. Korea, I'd say they do a great job. This concept is great for groups too. It's an experience. I definitely recommend Let's Meat! I give the owners props for bringing something totally different to Charlotte. A BIG THANK YOU!

igegsLbxgndewc1vmtpRaQ.text: My family and I love this place! It's 30/pp maybe a little more definitely pricey for a family of 4-5 but it's a great experience. You are required to cook your own food but u get unlimited choices of meat. Little tip request butter and garlic make your own garlic butter and season it up like you are at home. The ribeye and cow tongue were our favorite.

XRLgRhfJFClJgVBHeYHQUQ.text: Decided to come try Korean bbq for my 6 year anniversary with my boyfriend. When we first got there, (we were a couple minutes early) we were greeted by the managers who told us we had a couple minutes to wait, which we didn't mind. When they finally sat us down, our waitress came over and talked to us about what type of restaurant they were and helped us with everything we needed. She helped cook our meals for us, talked to us and just made us feel comfortable. Her personality was very bubbly and she was very attentive. A+ on the service! For the sides, we got all the tradition sides such as; kimchi, pickled radish, steamed bean sprouts, and all the other goodies! We ordered the garlic pork belly and the Bulgogi for our first tray of meats. Both were really great and I would have to say, my favorite! I also tried the spicy chicken, which honestly I wasn't too fond of. I felt like there was not enough flavor. We also ordered the corn and cheese on the random menu and to my surprise it was superb! The waitress suggested to eat it wrapped in lettuce and I did, it was good! One thing that I do find good but maybe bad to others is that, their portion is very small. I've had Korean bbq at other places and their meats come on a big tray versus this place delivers their meats in a small little side bowl. When we ordered the pork belly, it was only one piece, literally one slice of the pork belly. Its good because you can try different varieties of meat. But the downfall to that is, if I really like a certain type of meat, I have to keep reordering it. Other than that, I feel like everything was great! Definitely give it a try when you stop by!   On another note: I noticed that on their menu they are still adding more meats. So you are kind of limited.

klR34iiiTndaoqIQY1BRBw.text: Just moved to Charlotte from LA. Great to have a Kbbq here! Great atmosphere, service and meat options! We will be coming back. GoGoGo!!!

LW8bpmIhK2gM36m7VH0gbA.text: Super fun spot! We had a blast grilling our own food and tried a little of everything! Definitely expensive but it is unlimited. We really had a fun time here and the bulgogi was amazing. A great special occasion spot and a unique experience for Charlotte.

yGMfS9c-2S_3ZnXua6r-dg.text: It's seriously been so long since I've had Korean BBQ (bc of Charlotte's lack of one) that I can't compare to anywhere else besides what I make at home.   For $30/person, it's totally worth it to avoid having to purchase and prep the variety of meats and veggies/banchan from "the Asian store" to make a proper KBBQ myself. Definitely cheaper to make at home but is it worth the effort and buying in bulk quantities for a date night for two? No. Maybe for 5 or more.   Go if you even remotely like Asian flavor profiles or meat. It's worth it to support restaurants that are stepping out and doing something different than overpriced tacos or American fare. I'm tired of being bored with food options. Or just come to my house the next time we do KBBQ.

bBHJZvfTyF-9fQAB_9Qu1A.text: Growing up in Atlanta, where AYCE Korean BBQ options are abundant through the Asian neighborhoods within the suburbs, Let's Meat has surpassed all of my expectations for kbbq.   The service is so efficient, with an assembly line style kitchen set up in the back, and the quality of the meats are top notch. For $30 a person, you can pretty much eat any type of meat you'd like (outside of galbi), and banchan you can think of - from cheese corn to jiggae to steamed eggs!   I would encourage everyone who is visiting Charlotte, or even just passing through, to definitely check out Let's Meat. You won't regret it.

ETC3AqORfSkPixUvKzjS2Q.text: Finally! The Korean gods have made their way to Charlotte.   I have been patiently waiting for Korean food to arrive in Charlotte for years. There have been a few places here and there, but this is the first KBBQ that I've seen here.   We had a table of 6 for my husbands birthday. We came for lunch on a Saturday. There was a very short wait, and we were seated at a nice (slightly small) table. We happened to come when the Galbi was not at an extra charge, which was a nice surprise.   They brought all of the side dishes, waters, and rice very quickly. Our server was friendly and helpful. She did a lot of the cooking for us which was very nice. She gave the rest of our group a nice intro course on what meats to order first and what all of the dishes are.   The best meat I had was the bulgogi - it was sweet, marinated, and delicious. We tried nearly all of the different options they had, and they all were great.  Something that I really liked about this place is that it was so clean! Most times after you eat KBBQ, your hair and clothes will smell very strongly like meat. That was not the case here.  I hope that Lets Meat continues to have good reviews and good business. I haven't tried the Seoul restaurant next door, but since they are the same owners, I am thoroughly excited to go.

ONvRI387rOcded8kk6lTiQ.text: This was our first experience eating Korean BBQ. Bobby made us feel at home. He explained everything to us, and made sure we had a great experience. It's an awesome place run by awesome people. Will be going back soon!

_PBGXFENUjM0d_eh05U7fQ.text: I went to their website to take a look and see what the place is all about. There is no menu and not alot of information on their website. I called the restaurant and some guy answers the phone and I say.  "I am on your website and I can't find a menu anywhere on there do you have one online?." His answer was "We don't have a website" and I said "Yes you do im on it right now" and his response was "oh well".   We will not be checking this place out ever.

RMZY9LZ_sPeMRQwgJtQ7xA.text: This place is the best KBBQ join in the Charlotte. The meats are fresh and taste perfect after being cook by the staff or for those that have experience with Korean BBQ themselves. The staff is very friendly and helpful when it comes to meat selection.   Very satisfied customer.

KswtmmYF3YWq3dU5SkabQg.text: This place is amazing, especially if you're starving because it's all you can eat! I really enjoyed the food here. Our server was amazing and special shout outs to our food runner because we definitely ordered a lot. It gets busy here fast, we came during opening for dinner time and it was already getting crowded 15 minutes in on a weekday so be prepared! I can't wait to return because you can never go wrong with Korean bbq.

MdzFs3bfKx4WpQaZOGBi6Q.text: Whenever I travel I like to seek out what I can't get at home. When we were in LA I fell in love with Korean BBQ only to be heartbroken that nowhere in CLT did the same all you can eat cook your own Korean BBQ that was so popular out in CA.   I called a couple weekends after they opened to see about getting a reservation. No dice and the man I spoke with said the weekend dinner rush wait was 1-2 hours. Ugh! No thank you! So we waited a couple more weeks and went for lunch. There was no crowd for our Saturday lunch and we had the almost undivided attention of our waiter. We went a second time for an early Sunday dinner (pretty close to 5) and it was busier but we were able to get in. Word of caution - they will not seat you until your whole party is there.   The basics - it is all you can eat and you cook it yourself. Or, in our case on the first visit, the waiter cooked it for the most part while we burned our tongues impatiently taking out items. The second time we went the waiter was much more hands off and we were cooking ourselves. You can order as many meats as you want, as well as refills of the amazing sides they bring. Just don't be greedy because waste will be charged.   Winner winner brisket dinner - in my humble opinion the thinly sliced brisket is the best choice. It comes unseasoned so you can choose any of the sauces they bring to dip it in, or cook it with garlic and jalapeno. It is also a good meat to start with since it cooks quickly.   Bulgoli beef is my second favorite followed up by the squid and newly added ribeye. I am probably the only person in the world who doesn't go crazy for pork belly but I have enjoyed the red wine and red pepper pork belly. I would pass on the egg souffle and beef chunks.   Possibly because it comes out raw the food comes out super quickly. While waiting between meats, or for meats to cook, there is a huge assortment of sides brought out when you are seated so there is always something to nibble on. So far we've had two great visits and writing this review makes me want to plan a third!

ilj3Z3AUOk-TXw7sLZJbhg.text: Went for lunch on a weekday, was over all pleased with food and service. Our waiter, Nathan (I think that was his name) was very nice, he explained that they are buffet style restaurant but will change 10% if there is good wasted. He helped us cook the food the while time, and made some excellent suggestion along the way on how to pair the meat, veggie and sauce. The restaurant was nicely decorated, seems clean and opened. $29.99 per person with all you can eat meat and veggies. The quality of food was very good, I particularly enjoyed the bulgogi beef, it was nicely marinaded and very tender. Very satisfying to know there is a authentic Korean BBQ in Charlotte now.

reDexXEdEVKL5Gk_o0MSWA.text: Last night was my first time checking this place out, I took my 12 year old nephew that has never seen any kind of restaurant like this, we had a great experience. The service was incredible and the decor was very simplistic. We got to learn a lot about the Korean Foods we where enjoying. If your looking for a great place with a memory making experience, this is it.

nkP44aZAGcDh740c3UBuxA.text: This is place is not only the KBBQ Charlotte wants, but honestly what Charlotte needs! Growing up in Charlotte, there used to be a few Korean BBQ joints here (none were AYCE), but over the years they have all closed their doors. As a kid in a blended bicultural family  we would make bulgogi and Kimichi after church on Sundays, so Korean food has always had a special place in my heart. Naturally I decided to go out with friends to Let's Meat for my birthday and to see if this place really lived up to the hype. Let me tell you as a KBBQ fanatic, this place is one of the best I have had in America (yup..that includes LA and San Diego).   The pros: * Friendly staff (shout out to Tim for being the best waiter staff ever) - super friendly, helpful, and very talkative.  *Meat quality  - the meat here is on point - they aren't cutting corners to save a little extra $$$ and I appreciate that!  * Banchan - all of the banchan was on point! My only compliant was the lack of Sigeumchi Namul and Eomuk Bokkeum.   Tips for KBBQ newbies -  *Ask for half orders - if you want to try something, but you aren't sure you will like it ask for a smaller order.  *Don't be shy to ask for help - grilling takes practice ( p.s those scissors are there to cut the meat)  * Use the Lime/Lemon to clean the grill  *Ask for lettuce and wrap your meat in lettuce with some radish and soy bean paste!  * Not a first date spot- who wants to stuff their face in front of a new date? But, definitely a place that I would go before getting serious with someone. If they can't get down with the grilled squid or turn up their nose to kimchi...things aren't looking good for the long haul.   Honestly can't wait to go back. Alcohol is a bit pricey, so if you're looking to relive your days in Seoul - pregame before coming to eat and then rent a Karaoke room next door.

KHBXkihkgBx93SJfb2fSZw.text: I had an extremely unpleasant experience at their other restaurant, but these guys are really the only game in town when it comes to Korean. I came in Monday tax day around 8ish. I wanted to come on a day and time that would allow for better service. I picked well. Claire my waitress was excellent. The Bulgogi and the pickled radishes were some of my faves. Will be back, loved it, thank you Claire.   I want to add that they're two restaurants are extremely popular and during lunch and dinner on a Friday, Saturday, Sunday you could easily have a much different outcome.

VlbcoD0t4cRqhbiOGLcZdQ.text: I've had Kbbq at other major cities such as New York, Atlanta, etc. I was super excited when Let's Meat opened in Charlotte! My worst experience here was when I found a dead fly in my rice. When I showed management, they apologized profusely. That's good customer service. However, tonight made me feel really low and if anyone knows me, customer service is what makes it or breaks it for me at restaurants. After last night, they've lost one of their most loyal customers.   First off, don't order the beef chunks. I'm not sure if it was just an off night or what but they definitely tasted bad, like spoiled meat. The original pork belly was basically just a thick slab of fat. It was just inedible to me. Beef tongue was unpleasant as well.  Now onto what happened... Our server, Alec, barely did anything for our table. We went around 9:30 pm and the restaurant was definitely not busy. That didn't bother me though because I like to do all the cooking and flipping at our table anyways. I went with my girlfriend and niece who both got waters and I got a Sierra Mist. Since I was the one watching the food, I left my drink over to the other side of the table, closer to my girlfriend. When we got our check, we were rung up for two sodas. When asked about it, Alec said he would get his manager. The manager stated that since they noticed that there were "exchanges" with the drink between me and my girlfriend, they rang it up as two and her hands were tied about the matter.   Um, excuse me. What? Of course there were exchanges if I have to ask my girlfriend to pass me my drink. And yes, she took a sip but I was unaware that y'all were patrolling the area and that a sip would equate to a whole drink. Are you that money hungry for an additional $3 drink? Even so, I have been going to Let's Meat for so many times and have even forgiven you when I had the incident with the fly. As I mentioned, what I hated most was how they treated the situation and how poorly it was handled. I could care less about $3 honestly.   We didn't argue, I simply nodded, and we paid for our meal and left. After this experience, I won't ever be back and will rather drive to Atlanta where the food is better anyways.

ZwjksiXXFem8RSHSbG9B3A.text: Been here several times food is great. Came here this time we were told we had to wait thirty minutes not because their busy but because the next shift of servers does not come in for thirty minutes.  Dumbest thing I've ever heard. Really 5:30 PM and not enough servers.

_IsdynBDs8J7gJMgvqKTig.text: The place is empty, but there is a 30 min wait bc they don't have enough people working to serve guests.

Q4RpJJnLZd9ivT3taRXVyg.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT KOREAN BBQ! This is the best way to enjoy KBBQ! It's $30pp for 2 hours. Yes, they keep track of time.  There's a menu to order from, and they bring it to you. It's not self-serve. The portions they brought out were small but I liked that. This was my first time so the small portions allowed me to try many different items. Once you find the one you like, just keep ordering!  Kalbi is a premium item, so that's an additional $13 per order. I didn't think it was worth it because everything else on the menu was just as good or better.   For the softest and juiciest beef, get the beef chunks. The pork belly is a must have...yum! The squid and shrimp were also very good!  They don't have Pa Muchim (Scallion Salad) but they do have something similar, still good, but I do love and prefer all the scallions!  Definitely check it out!   The space is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and very attentive, clean bathroom (though I got nervous and eventually resorted to karate kicking the handle of the toilet to get it to flush.. phew!)  Also, they taught me to use the lime to clean the grill after each round. This lime thing is amazing! They never have to change the grill and at the end of the meal, the grill was still so clean!  Oh! And no hot tea... which I thought was weird for an Asian restaurant.

rNGMqmNLDMwvVtsaTuouuQ.text: The grill doesn't get hot enough ... thinly sliced brisket took 15min to cook and and I like my beef medium rare.  My waiter was terrible, he felt some type of way when I told him I don't need him to cook for me because he didnt look like knew what he was doing. Then had the nerve to tell me I didn't know what I was doing... when I left I had raw meat on the grill that took too long to cook and he tried to charge me extra ... This is the first Korean bbq in the state of North Carolina if I'm not mistaken. so I assume most here never had experience good Korean bbq.

zA_5H8I8ixKaujp6kPGspw.text: Awesome selection and great service for our party of 10. Ribeye and bulgogi were my favorites. Drink choices were also exceptional

AHfAXucLrE-olU_0qs9QAQ.text: I've been there twice and it is ok. The first time I went there it was very very confusing.  If you take a look at the menu you basically don't understand anything about it. The very good thing about it is that they film the menu on a big screen in order to let you understand better what they offer (the bad thing is that I discovered that big screen at the end of the night).  The meat is nothing special. Nothing that is gonna make you say "wow". The seafood in my opinion is under the average.   In other situations I would probably rated a place like this 2 stars, but since it is a very very original restaurant, I rated it 3.   I hope in the future the food is gonna improve because it is probably one of the most original restaurants in Charlotte.

_LxGfNACsCuyRAAK6BwF0g.text: Unfortunately I had to change my rating from Really good to two thumbs down. I frequented the place but no longer after last night.   1. The grill plates are completely warped so everything was just sticking on and burning. If you like a little char and caramelization on your meats when grilling it's stuck on   2 The meat quality was POOR compared to the last 5 times I've been. Super fatty, poorly cut, overly sweet or salty just TERRIBLE. That's being nice.   3. Steamed rice came out with crunchy dried bits throughout   4. Salad dry and way under dressed and lettuce comes out cut in enormous pieces   FOR 40$ a head with a 5$ tip this is RIDICULOUS! I'm not going back!

hJfk8sio6ChoodIiGI7sjw.text: 1st time at Korean BBQ and instantly fell in love. It's an all you can eat place $30 / person and kids 4-10 12 bucks. You get 2 hrs to eat and that's plenty. 3 meats at a time they bring out 2nd you cook the meats yourself. A super cool experience everyone must try.

iyyLhrhzZmZioX7DtBLAgg.text: This place is better to go in a group so you can try as many different things from the menu. You need to get the corn cheese! The service was amazing! They were extremely helpful and patient with my family especially since it was our first time trying Korean BBQ. I love the atmosphere and vibe inside the restaurant. I suggest coming in early because the wait can be around an hour to an hour and a half. I would definitely come back!!

9Fz_1_fdMldfwJKm3kznGw.text: I had an extremely friendly and delicious experience when I went for the first time to any traditional korean bbq place.

BqnNdejMKMY-OJoqXPXdBg.text: I moved here 2 years ago and was so bummed to find out there was no KBBQ in Charlotte; so once I heard Let's Meat was opening up I followed their progress closely. My husband and I went on the 2nd day and were pleasantly surprised. There was a sign saying they were still hiring, but there was staff galore and everyone was so friendly. If you have never been before, they will walk you through the entire process and make your dinner as pleasant as possible. Once we were seated, they promptly brought out the side dishes (banchan) which were all fresh and delicious. We ordered the Korean Steamed Egg and White Rice as well to enjoy with our banchans. Our meats arrived just as fast as the side dishes and we went to work! My husband ordered bulgogi all night and I ordered the miso, garlic and original thin sliced pork belly. Everything, EVERYTHING was fresh, savory, and what we were hoping for. The owner even came to our table and cooked some of the meat for us! Overall: FOOD 5/5 fresh, marinated just right - authentic KBBQ Service 5/5 will take into consideration it was opening week, but they do take their time explaining KBBQ to first timers Cleanliness 5/5  Other criteria to consider: Parking seems it could be hard during busy times. We parked about 2 blocks away. They don't take reservations. It is $30 per person all you can eat within a 2 hour limit (more than enough time) cannot bring leftovers home so order accordingly. Soju needs 2+ drinkers to order.

itd3huJk7ogRkpPmPlpD2Q.text: love it love it and love it. Friendly staff, Alec was our guy. Ask for him you wont be disappointed

suqUCTDi85LWqm_w9WBWsQ.text: So good. Didnt eat all day to make sure I had room. Eat everything. The tounge was awesome. Loved the picked treats and sauces. Great service.

KN_IfBjMEnDFsd9RV4kXgQ.text: I absolutely love this place. The Korean BBQ is amazing as well as the atmosphere. Our waiter was informative and helped us with all of our questions and needs.  Everyone should try this place.

AFxlwDfy-FyjC4olwWvKSA.text: First visit last night, VERY POOR SEATING/WAIT experience. We were party of 6, it was alright for us to wait an hour or so because we really want to have korean BBQ. Almost 2 hour marked, party of 8 people got seated before us when we have been waiting 30 minutes before them. WTF, 30 minutes was a significant amount of time! I went to the front desk and ask what is going on. She said they don't have avaialble rable for 6, but there are tables for 4. But still you dont treat your costumer that way! You talked to them and explain, give them option nit when they're waiting for 30 minutes ahead of the other customers you just seated! The lady pointed to the other staff that it was her fault. They should seat people strategically. I said yes, you have poor planning, look you have 2 people seated in an 8-people table. They should have asked us if we want to separate table since there's no available one to accommodate us but DO NOT SEAT the customer behind us when we have been waiting for more than an hour now! We finally got seated i don't know how after the fiasco because my son and I are so upset to what they did. Now another upsetting part, remember we are hyngry now and upset. Seated on a 1 burner table, can only get meat 3 at a time. I was thinking what, hownlong would it take us to be able to eat, we will be eating like chicken. You get 3 kinds of meat at a time, so ok. When the meat arrived, the were giving 1 piece of marinated pork belly as big as bacon slice, 1 piece of ribeye as big as my palm and 5 pieces of medium size shrimp. Wow, you got to be kidding me with 6 grown people, hungry and this is how much we are going to be looking forward to, It was torture. I have been to several korean place but this the worst.!!!!! The meat was so limited every time it arrives that i said this will be my last visit in this place. I will tell my friend about how bad it is. I would have not given a 1 star if I can. I am not hard to please and we usually get passed a bad customer service but this one I can't let go. They always say you pay for the service not the food. Well this one, the amount of money I paid was a big lost because of our bad experience

rO8FbCeF7tcOhgdu993U_g.text: I had a great experience my husband & I went there, great service which was Steven who was our server gave us the best experience! Amazing staff + managers. Glad to have a Korean bbq close to home! Definitely recommend.

UidZhIdF7gx_JmcatF_zSQ.text: I have been waiting for Korean bbq to open in Charlotte for a long time. Finally it is here. Great service, super fast, super welcoming. oi51iulPnqoqc2e0jPW4rw.text: While the food was so good that I way-overate and felt horribly full the next day, what really stood out to me was the flawless service and attentive (and present!) owners. TjiNlWzrAA-c4zi8ateO_Q.text: A great place to go with friends and/family. Their atmosphere is open and bright. I love how fast and how consistent they are with bringing the next round of food out to us. It's nice having a KBBQ place in Charlotte for once!

7WDQLUkvEUocRCUlIGhyww.text: I went here last night as a girls night out with my family. It was a great experience and super fun to try different meats. My favorites were the rib eye, the shrimp, and the corn cheese was pretty yummy as well. I hope to go back again.

Efl2g01ZhmoIKnAYCSUgGg.text: This place was awesome. Basically the only kbbq place in Charlotte so you don't have much of a choice. I'm not gonna say every dish was amazing cos that's bs. 4fP9eikRfZOibLPoZR5XPQ.text: This was our first time here, we were seated at 6 p.m. on a Saturday with no wait. Everything was incredible - fun atmosphere, amazing food! n6GRa976FDHMLu-R9Yy61Q.text: First timer and our server, Nathan, was very helpful with suggestions and showing us everything. Was very filling, went for lunch and was full for the remainder of the day. I will definitely be back.

6ndkCq6EcicL8Ke1toBujQ.text: Probably the best AYCE Korean BBQ place I been to in the NC / Virginia area. Nathan is such an awesome server. The ribeye steak was very thick and juicy. So many different choices of meat and side dishes. Definitely will be back.

wyfEELYosbUex1-DhcO4sA.text: This place is a pretty decent Korean bbq restaurant! I'm Korean so I've been to many aaaaall over the country, so I can't say this is even on my top 10. The meat & banchans were good, not great. BUT! Korean BBQ is all about marinated short ribs (galbi) and pork belly (samgyupsal). I found it absurd and even upsetting that they charge $13.99 for galbi. Galbi should be standard, it's literally the definition of Korean BBQ. There are many different types of pork dishes, but even the pork bulgogi isn't your standard Korean pork bulgogi...it's not spicy; I just found that odd! It was worth going for the experience, but I'd rather buy galbi & samgyupsal from G-Mart or Peppero and make them myself for the money I spent here!

TdFAkwCXxYLnfDFWvK_Qhw.text: It's worth experiencing but i wouldn't go back unless it was to take out of town guess for a different, unique experience. Definitely not worth taking kids as they charge $11.99 for kids 4-10 n anyone over 10 gets charged adult prices of $30. Be sure to look over your check (i almost never look at the check n usually just put my cc n the check presenter without looking at the check) especially if you have a party of 6 or more since they auto grat for that which i have no problem with if they would not have overcharged me. We had 5 adults and a 3 year old child and the server still auto grat us. She never asked the age of our child and just charged $11.99 for him - I'm assuming so she could auto grat. Once i pointed out that he was only 3 (he ate maybe 3 bites of rice) she acted like she didn't know why (dead giveaway she knew exactly what she was doing by charging the $11.99 instead of saying she thought he was 4) the $11.99 was on there n would see if a manager would take the charge off. When we got the check again i reviewed it and the $11.99 charge was removed but our check amount was higher than before. This time there was a $23.95 charge added which we had to ask to get removed again. The auto grat was still on there but i didn't bother with it. I normally tip 20% as the norm and the server was actually pretty good (would've been excellent except she went missing at one point n we had empty beers) so i would've probably left 25% (would've left 30% if she wouldn't have gone MIA for a bit) but i guess she felt it was in her best interest to overcharge us n get the auto grat on as much as she could. I want to think it was just an honest mistake but with her not asking how old our child was and then the other charge getting put on there it leads me to believe she was only concern about padding her pocket. 3 for avg food, 4 for unique experience (would've a 5 if they had a broader choice of meats - half of it seemed to be different flavors of pork belly), 0 for dishonesty equals a 2.3 which bumps down to a 2 star.

eFoqNFFZUsG41MXZDTtEXw.text: EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!!!!! We had a group of seven people and we were seated in a reasonable time. The waiter was very nice and he recommended the way we needed to cook our food, being that we have never been here before. In two hours our group had tried almost everything on the menu. The day that we went the Kalbi and the Flavored Kalbi was free but I do not think that it was worth the $13 up-charge that it would be normally. I really like mushrooms and chicken but I did not like either of them.

AzXGi2gPite-esmlat2wdw.text: New to Charlotte and heard about this place... service was great, Peter was very patient while explaining the process as this is not your typical K-BBQ restaurant and Michael (I think the only America employee) was just as good delivering items to the table. The FOOD although not your traditional K-BBQ was good, just small portions which worked out great as it was a goal to try everything on the menu (I didn't try everything). $29.99 is the price all the time and 2 hour limit was not an issue although you might think it would be.

z260fKKD9Z96xEeFliBf6w.text: Always on point. Brought some first timers and they loved it. Fresh meat and banchan all-day! Manager was so attentive to our tables. Definitely will be back! And open for lunch!! No lines and everything was available

2oTRMNuDMKGOK03TdHpRSA.text: We were looking for a Korean BBQ, saw this place on Yelp and liked the great reviews so we decided to try it for ourselves.  Wow!  This place is amazing!  Our waiter Zach provided awesome service and info on the food and we had a great experience.  Lots of choices of meats and sides and they will keep bringing them as long as you want more.  We tried the beef bulgogi, 3 different flavors of pork belly, pork bulgogi, spicy chicken and shrimp.  My favorites were the bulgogis....they are marinated and very flavorful.  It's really crowded on weekends and the wait is north of 2 hours so it's best to go during the week.  It's about $30 per person, but you can eat your fill!!  We'll definitely be returning!

aHThUqoQZJpaQfyMgtqImQ.text: Great Service, Lots of tasty sides, great meal for conversation. Dipping sauces are great! End the meal with the banana fermented wine!

VP_5Xh8pPQ2DcyhrWaDQqA.text: This was our first experience with Korean BBQ and it did not disappoint. We loved everything we tried and we were able to try tons of different things! aE-UcvudevZ1J60fxstMvQ.text: I told my bestfriend I wanted to go to Home Goods to get a few things for my new place. C3GISNRjDoRHA3YdNHN_QQ.text: I've been waiting 4 years for an authentic Korean BBQ spot to open up in Charlotte! I was so close to moving back to my homet own just to get a taste! The food was amazing and I never ran out of food the server always made sure we werent missing anything! The only hiccup is the wait time. rVCUGbmZM1k1eVETfExZ6w.text: Finally! There is korean bbq in charlotte. AND it's legit. We ate here during the first week in operation and it exceeded all of our expectations. The staff are super friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere is upbeat. And most importantly, the food is excellent. I tend to be a bit skeptical of all you can eat kbbq, as the quality of the meat is usually subpar. However, Let's Meat offered great quality food all the way around - from the meat to the side dishes, it was exactly what we have been waiting for in Charlotte. The kimchi is delicious and I would recommend the bulgogi and pork belly. We will definitely be repeat customers. Highly recommend it!

s-XYxX_Rd79DuWS57E2DCQ.text: My goodness I wish this place could be in RTP. Great great Korean BBQ!   I personally like beef tough, shrimp, mushroom and veggie plate the best. The cooking of squid was really interesting. Bulgogi, pork belly and beef chunk were more fatty and salty.   My waiter, Carl, was super nice and helpful! He was the sweetest waiter I could ever imagine. The people here were all really nice and happy.   Overall, this is a must-try place in NC if you are into Korean/Japanese bbq. To be completely honest, this is not a place comparable to Gyu-Kaku. But it is truly crown jewel in North Carolina.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

3D4y09J4b74wmw4EYAX21w.text: As soon as I heard about this place, I couldn't wait to try it. Luckily, it wasn't announced much before they opened, so I didn't have to wait long. I love Seoul Food and Meat Company, so I figured they would do a good job with this as well.   Boy was I right. This immediately jumped to be one of my favorite Charlotte restaurants. The food is outstanding. It's all you can eat for $30. There's a 2 hour limit, but we were told it wasn't strictly enforced. If you can eat that much meat for 2 hours straight, I'd be impressed. They have a bunch of pork and beef options and a chicken option. Everything we tried was great. The chicken was probably at the bottom of the list. The non-marinated meats and the beef options were our favorites. The sides were awesome as well. We all loved the dipping sauces too.   The service is superb. They have you order 3 meats at a time and they are constantly checking back to see what you want to order next. You cook your own meat on a grill on the table which is awesome. The waiter will help you get started and it's pretty easy. They are helpful with recommendations and bring your uncooked food out almost immediately. You are pretty much never waiting for food.   We had heard how busy and popular it was, so we got there 5 minutes before they opened and there was already at least a 10 person line. We were still seated right when they opened, but it was pretty impressive. It seems like they get people through pretty fast. There were only a few people waiting when we left.   It may seem a little pricey, but what you get is worth it. I could not recommend this place not more highly. It's a must try on the Charlotte restaurant scene!

Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

MVsXSsjYvFOgil9x0TuStw.text: I can't lie... I don't know why you would go anywhere else if you wanted a ton of meat with an Asian flair. Let's Meat is Charlotte's first True Korean BBQ joint and it has been met which an overwhelmingly positive lot of feedback. This is due to a extensively well trained front of house, who understand that the vast majority of their customers are unfamiliar with this cuisine. Follow that up with an amazing back of house that make the concept inviting and easy to understand, this is key to getting people to step out of their comfort zone and try something new!  Tuesday night was the night. I figured it wouldn't be too crazy on a Tuesday, boy was I wrong. The hype has already spread around the hive and they were slammed. Surprisingly, while there were a few large parties waiting for a big table, they were able to seat me and my girlfriend immediately. The consensus among most reviews is that the service is outstanding. Indeed, they have a ton of people running around tending to every table. Dedicated Food Runners bringing out the sides, sauces, and meat. Servers who are really well versed in explaining the process. If it's you're first time they'll walk you through the menu and even cook your first few servings of meat, as well as continuously check in on your meats once you've taken the reins.  My god, not only was it easy, it was damn delicious. A lot of places around the QC that have pork belly either serve it with a generous amount that has no sear, or use the thinnest or cheapest cuts they can get. Genuinely great pork belly is hard to come by around here, but this kBBQ grill is perfect for it. Super thick cuts and all you can eat, you'll get a slight bit of char with a perfect, golden-brown sear if you do it right. The best part, you can flip your meat as many times as you want and it doesn't change the outcome at all. The whole concept is super fun.  Along with the meats, you'll get all kinds of other great additions to dinner like kimchi, steamed bean sprouts, plenty of rice, pickled daikon radish, seaweed salad, and my personal favorite: garlic stems! The stems are cooked down and served with this light, slightly sweet red sauce that is wonderful. You'll get some lettuce to make your own wacky wrap combinations as well.  Our server and 'instructor' Tim was just fantastic. Every extra side we wanted was brought within seconds and he showed us all the tricks of the trade to make the most out of the new concept. Another guy named David also stopped by and showed us his take on using different ingredients together to make delicious bites of meaty goodness. These people really want you leaving with a smile and to get that 'wow' factor.  They have a few slots on their menu labeled 'coming soon' so I can't wait to see what else they have in store. Right now they have beef, pork belly, chicken, veggie plates, and kalbi (short ribs) which is actually the only plate you'll pay extra for. We didn't try the short ribs because of the incredible value you get from the standard fixed price.  I can't recommend this place enough. $30 per person, plus your drink, and you'll be in meat heaven. Only a couple of blocks from the Bland St. light rail station, it's super convenient and super fun! We'll be back with the whole fam next time!

sqgzi8grNIH-BG7tUoRRdg.text: It is all-you-can-eat BBQ place for two hours at $29.99. It seems like two hours are short but it is not! They have all variety of seasoned pork belly(samkyusal) and beef selections. Remember that they charge you extra $13.99 per order of galbi.   Also you can grill seafood(shrimp or squid). I enjoyed spicy chicken and beef brisket and corn cheese, yum! It is good to enjoy various side dishes(banchan) including kimchi.(grilling kimchi and pork belly(samkyusal) is always awesome)   If you are a meat lover and want to enjoy different kind of meat at the same time, it is worthy it. Wish they could serve simple dessert at the end of the meal like other typical Korean BBQ places:)

zSQnNRdYqzf5FH8rYEqhiQ.text: Hmm, this is a buffet yes, but unlike the typical buffet. Think of it as more of a Korean style version of "The Melting Pot". Your options include spicy chicken, shrimp, beef short ribs, pork, steak, squid, etc...the cheesy corn is a favorite. You pay roughly $30 and order your meats, the sides and spices are brought to your table, you choose additional sides such as salads, rice noodles and/or rice (white/brown). You cook your selections on the grill located in the center of your table. Great presentation and you can cook multiple items at same time.  You keep ordering whatever selections you like at no additional cost. Eat until you are satisfied, try each item on menu if you desire...  Beer/wine selections avail but not included in the $30 charge. The time limit per table is about 2 hours.... Ample parking but on a busy night you may find it difficult to find an open spot.

83UhcV2d15n9VPVpTZXxJQ.text: My husband and I stopped in at Let's Meat right after a Panthers game on Sunday. Since it was an early dinner, there wasn't a wait. So glad we stopped in because it was so much fun and delish!  We sat down and were explained the process of cooking your own meats and all the sides/additions. $30 for all you can eat.  We also started with some Soju. A bit in, our waiter brought us out a beer and recommended pouring some Soju in a cup with beer. Absolutely great tip!   There were so many meat options and we had fun trying them in rotations. I was surprised at how quick they brought everything out! The GM stopped at our table and showed us some variations she likes to do. Service was spot on awesome.   Absolutely fun meal and evening!

Sha5mk8Ib7Az3b-xfM7olg.text: All you can eat Korean BBQ. Need I say more? If you want the meats, and all of it. This is your spot. The only one of its kind in CLT. Gets pretty busy so there's usually always a wait.

lCu2M2jchXVu0fCGlHQqJw.text: This is the second time I've been here. This time we have 7 adults and 2 kids, 5 and 3 year old. The host informed me that the 5 year old will be charged either if he eats or not. He only eats his food and we fed him already. He told us that we can leave the kids sitting out at the waiting area or he will be charged. He said it many times regardless we were discussing what to do. We agreed that one of us will take turn to watch the kids but later on the waiter told me they can sit at the table. He told us that it will be an hour a wait but when our party got there he sat us right away. The food is good and fresh. Service is excellent. Except the front desk/ host was terrible we almost left the restaurant to go somewhere else.

FXWHH9XjlPIxjLzy6uPTig.text: I've been to tons of Korean BBQ places and I gotta say I am surprised to find one of the better ones right in Charlotte. They are somewhere in top 3 for me for sure!  I really love the way the place is laid out. Super clean and beautiful bathrooms, awesome wall murals... I just really like the way it's been done. Classy but casual, has both form and function.   Cost of an amazing experience for 4 was almost $200 including drinks and tips. I was in Chicago not long ago and paid more than double that for a party of 4, and the food here got the one in Chicago beat by a mile.   Their sides are all very well done... nice to see they gave each and all the same level of attention. Speaking of attention, staff were awesome!!! They were always on top of everything which we appreciated very much.   Meats were all super fresh, excellent sauces seasoned oils... just absolutely everything about the experience was pleasant. Will definitely return when I'm in the area.

rJgJuP3IxKRxADl5BPD6Hw.text: I give this place a 5 star based on the great service, our server Vien was very helpful, he explained everything since it was my first time at the restaurant. Food was delicious. You can order 3 protein at a time then again and again, however there is a time limit 2hour but that's more than enough to get your belly full.

WW0tUfpec7hU0rH3u5gMwA.text: The meats were very fresh. The service was good. Cecilia kept coming back to make sure we were ok with everything.  The cow tongue was particularly good, as was the beef brisket and bulgolgi. The side dishes were decent.  Egg souffle and spicy cold noodles were delicious as well. Got a bit tired of cooking the food half way through. The tong is a little too large to handle the small pieces of meat. I've only been to korean bbqs where the staff grilled for you so a little instruction and tips would've been helpful. Bit pricey at $30, and kalbi costs an extra $13.99 i think. but it's really the only korean bbq in town so try it out. It's pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

ShoSVuYOW-MHJK7fjYkg-A.text: The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because we did not know how expensive it was going to be when we walked in and sat down. Some would argue $30 for dinner is normal, but for those on a budget, it is easy to feel duped when you sit down and realize that you will be paying $30 for your meal and will be fined an extra 10% if there are any leftovers when you finish. We should have done our research, I will say that for sure. But I am glad we stayed for the meal because it was an incredible experience and well worth it!   We were served immediately as we sat down and platters of various sides and sauces were brought to our table within seconds. Let's Meat offers unlimited meats and sides from various categories: Beef, Pork, Chicken, Shrimp, Squid, etc... so our group ordered at least 1 item from each category to try and get our money's worth. Everything was amazing!! And the different sauces available extended our combination options and added an element of guest creativity. Consensus from the table was that beef bulgogi was the favorite, but those willing to try the squid contended that it was a close second. Our server stopped by often, which was helpful since our group had never been before. I assume that in a date setting they would be a little more hands off, because I would be less inclined to come back knowing someone would be interrupting me every 5 minutes. But I will give the benefit of the doubt and assume our waiter was only visiting so often because he knew we were all new!   I will definitely come back here again, but will plan it out for a time when I have the appetite to eat and the appetite to spend.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

55tcFQSxu37JEx5uI2wArg.text: All right guys. Charlotte finally got their first all you can eat kbbq, and I have to admit, it's pretty fucking good. After having some of the best Korean bbq from cities like Atlanta and DC, I had pretty high standards but knowing this was a first for Charlotte I lowered my standards. As far as the 2 hour limit, that's not an issue. Your gonna be full by the first hour (if you need more than 2 hours to eat, you have a problem lol). I think I've gotten lucky the couple times I've came here, not having to wait more than 5-10 min to get a table. Parking can be tricky and of course it's first come first serve so no reservations. Once you get in, you won't be disappointed. We were allowed to get 3 orders of meat at a time. I'd suggest sticking to your "more expensive" meats such as beef or seafood rather than chicken. My favorites are the beef bulgogi, and fatty brisket. My only complaint is food comes out randomly and the servers don't seem to care, what I mean is we ordered 3 sides of white rice and the server only brought us 2, when we asked about the 3rd, they had to "double check" the ticket at which point we were told the rice is still cooking. That was just a minor hiccup, it happens. I'm not gonna get my panties in a bunch over rice, of course I'm there for the bbq . If your still deciding if you should try this place, it's definitely an experience you'll enjoy, and there's plenty on the menu that will suit your fancy.

YPgj9e1-MPPePNY5gzpFqQ.text: If you're doing keto or just generally love the meat sweats--you should try Let's Meat. My wife and my in-laws enjoyed our all you can eat meat session. Unfortunately, we couldn't make it the whole 2 hours! Highly recommend the pork belly.

bqQg1p3BvCHVJjDmceFVkA.text: When you go, ask for Selena!!!! And when you order food, make sure to get the brisket. It's amazing. And i can't even believe how delicious the corn cheese was. It's well worth the money spent. I'm thankful there's delicious KBBQ here for me to enjoy.

qwVAaNkoeCC0UhPHiiuRkQ.text: Very excited that Charlotte uptown opens a new restaurant. My boyfriend and I went there for Sunday afternoon; the overall experience was great.  Pros: 1. Our waiter, Green, was very helpful and nice. He came to our table quite often, telling us BBQ technics and asking if we wanted more food. 2. The meet was awesome. We ordered pork belly, beef tongue, beef briskets and beef chucks. They were marinated in a nice way and very tasty. 3. The appetizers were good, along with side dishes such as the corn cheese and egg souffle. 4. I liked the drinks, especially the grape juice. $2 each is a fair price.  Cons: 1. We arrived at the restaurant at 4:33pm and there was a long line outside. The place opened at 4:30pm but it seems that there were only one or two people who led the customers to the table, so the "welcoming section" is not very efficient. 2. There was a "coming soon" section on the menu, so I guess the restaurant is still improving its selection. I would like to have some kind of seafood if possible. 3. We were among the first group entering the restaurant, but we were told that they ran out of thin sliced pork belly; did not expect it to happen.  For $30 pp, this is a place worth trying if you love meat (especially beef). We plan to come here once a month in the future (if no other good place is opening ).

VvFRPBvmbNqVe6Cm-n2hQA.text: My son loves this place so he wanted me to come for his birthday! Was great food- loves the atmosphere and the food was crazy good!! Will be back!

rmgHaahIx28zr3vTALXiRQ.text: My friends and I had been on the road for about 7 hours and were starving. We looked for different places around the city and had found this one. Thank goodness we came when we did because they had kalbi included in their all you can eat menu for a short period! Our waitress was kind and had help teach us how to cook the meat and always kept our stove clean. There were so many meats to choose from and sides. My favorite meat there was probably the pork bolgigi. The egg souffle was soft and good. I've never had cold spicy noodles before, but it went pretty good with the meat. They give you plenty of side dishes to share too. The restaurant was cute and I enjoyed the layout. They don't have great Korean BBQ places where I'm from so I'm glad we had tried out this place. They give you 2 hours for all you can eat, but this is definitely more than enough time. Each plate comes out with a good amount of meat so you will get filled up pretty quickly!

k5LPqTTNzoUyRtxhD4IRJg.text: i cannot believe i found good kbbq in north carolina.  inside is modern and spacious and great for groups. we got seated immediately on a tuesday night. yc4goxhHMEByy3bIZt_NbQ.text: Please do better!  You're the *only* AYCE Korean bbq in Charlotte and you should set a high standard.  This review is going to be honest and straightforward, as I've eaten at quite a few Korean BBQ places in Cali, NY, NJ and FL where I have lived  Service- very good. The wait staff is on point, food came out rather quickly. Very attentive to our needs (and there wasn't many), accommodating and receptive.   Atmosphere- it's located next to its sister restaurant so they share the same modern-esque concrete wall and industrial look.  It was a little loud from the music and people conversing, the sounds bounce off the walls as there isn't anything to dampen the hubbub.  We didn't mind, it livened up the place.   The food-  well, here is what I am hoping they would do better on. I asked for hot tea, since it was raining pretty hard out and we sat in the car for 20 minutes as there wasn't any standing room to wait to be seated. No reservations so we pretty much took a chance on a dreary rainy Thursday night.   The don't serve anything hot. No hot tea, no green tea, no Barley or Corn tea... right.  So beer it is.   So we ordered the four choices of beef to start with, 2 flavored, a brisket and the tongue. We also ordered the egg souffle, a couple bowls of rice and the mushrooms.  The banchan came out quickly, followed by the freshly sliced semi frozen brisket and tongue. I quickly threw those on the grill without hesitance. The rice came out next, it had formed a chewy crust on top making it seem like it had been sitting for a while.  As I prepared myself for the first bite of the first meat of the first Korean bbq in Charlotte, I noticed the cooking tongue had a white circumference. Without thinking too much about it, I grabbed a Cooked piece, chewed it and began to gag so I spit it out. It seems like someone had FORGOTTEN to CLEAN it.  Yup. Someone forgot to peel off the rough sharp outer layer surrounding the bovine's tongue, I gagged because it felt like i had just swallowed a Rose bush.  Why did i order this you ask?  Because if you've ever had it, you know tongue is good when it's good.   I told our server about the issue and even had him touch the spikes on the raw tongue and said he would inform and get the manager....  who never came.  We figured who the manager was after a few minutes but she was clearly too busy (or maybe didn't want to be bothered?) by our issue.  She walked frantically between tables, to the front desk and to the back without smiling much. We didn't want to make a big deal about it so just sucked it up to a lost cause.   Souffle was left on the stovetop for 2 minutes too long, the eggs were pretty much scrambled in soup when we ate it. It's supposed to be sorta on the silky side. Good flavor tho.   The brisket was simply ok, it was cut a little too thin (it was a little fatty too) so it pretty much turned to a messy cheesesteak type material. If only I had some bread, onions and cheese I coulda made a legit Philly.    The flavors on the other two beef dishes were also just ok, it felt a little "toned down" to cater to the general taste... it didn't quite taste as authentic as I've had before.  I didn't get the saltiness and umami of the soy, the heavy aroma of the sesame oil or punch of the pepper flakes or garlic; I felt like I was eating sweet meat and a little hint of something something.   Oh, and about the portions, they give you about 1/2 cup worth of meat so you have to order three times as much to feel like you're actually eating something... listen I'm no heffer. I just dislike having to flag someone down for more food especially since I have to cook it too!  We ordered the pork dishes next, and I understand while it says pork belly... it felt like I was eating lard belly.  It was mostly fat to be honest, I had to cut out a fair amount of the white jiggly stuff just so I didn't have to shave off a few years of my life. The wine pork belly was decent, the curry one didn't have much curry flavor (weird because it was so yellow, you'd think it was loaded) and the hot pepper pork... wasn't even worthy of any scoville units.    The king mushrooms were dry (it's not that hard to slice them real quick per order is it?) and after that we decided to call it quits since we were told (when we first got there) that it's a 2 hour seating. It felt like they were already asking us to leave before we even ordered.  Hello, welcome, you have two hours, ready to order and GO!    So all in all, I hope this is read by anyone who care enough to read it, and by the owners.  This place really has the potential to really make a name for itself.  I understand that Charlotte is a young, growing expanding town, now is the time to set a benchmark to be the only place in town that's worth going to.   I gave two stars and I'm hoping to give 4 or 5 after I finally get over the fear of the tongue incident!  Really though, who doesn't like a good tongue?!

YMm5_OefiU3OiLDqjaSCuA.text: I was so excited to have a AYCE (All You Can Eat) Korean BBQ spot open up in Charlotte. Your closest options before we're on independence and for me it was a bit of a trek for a small plate of food.  If it's your first time make sure you let them know as it's an experience that can be made or broken by the server.  However if you've got a friend that's been it would be great to bring them along.  This is the only place to get AYCE KBBQ for now and my only draw back is that you've got to pay a lot extra for Kalbi and some other meats while all the other places I've been have it included.  I will say those places are in cities that have multiple options so they've got to stay competitive.  Over all the food is good and service isn't to bad, come hungry and ready to eat to get your monies worth $30 get you fed and they've got a verity of Korean 21 and up options as well as soda.

2Tw3FvzlmKecEkugOPMifw.text: Let's Meat Kbbq is legit! I've had Kbbq across the nation and it's definitely up there when it comes to customer service, dining experience, and quality. I love how the order comes out in small quantity versus slabs and plates of meat. This made the dining experience so much better. I am also a firm believer in not wasting food. Although the pork belly came by the slice, it was amazing. It gave us an opportunity to try the different marinades and flavors. That was a plus! I had no complaint about the variety of meat. It was perfect without being too overwhelming. The spacious of the restaurant was a major plus! There were enough space between each table for privacy. Overall, it was an amazing experience. The price point was perfect, especially for a city without many options when it comes to Kbbq.  I can't wait to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing experience!

frggFX8-xnGmXcwrnsAAng.text: This spot has the groundwork to be something special but what they really need is competition. Let's Meat KBBQ is your typical communal KBBQ experience where you come together with friends to enjoy the meats, soju, and laughter. It's not amazing high-quality meat, but it's more about having a good time. Take it from a Korean-American dude currently living in KBBQ heaven that is Southern California for the last 4 years--this spot is solid for the area, but it can be so much better.  Food: First, a quick guide on how to start your first order: Ask for chopped garlic and jalapenos to add to your cooking meat. Order salad (to be eaten together with meat for balance), fermented bean paste, steamed egg, fermented bean soup (doenjang jjigae), and spicy tofu soup (soondubu). Don't worry about overwhelming the server, this is what they're trained for. Best of all, it's all free and comes with the meal! As for meats, start with a couple plates of thinly sliced beef brisket and move onto heavier meats like steak and pork belly in the middle of the meal and finally finish with more beef brisket. Dip your cooked meats in the brisket sauce, chili sauce, sesame oil/salt combo, or bean paste. Eat with salad and radish paper for more balanced, flavorful bites.  The selection of meats is kind of limited and you can't get any marinated beef dishes (yangnyeom galbi) without paying an additional $13.99. You're pretty much stuck with brisket, steak, bulgogi (which is marinated but it's a waste of money to order this filler food, trust me), and pork belly. Overall the meat was just okay in quality--don't expect perfectly marbled wagyu. Of note, the steak was cut disastrously. The pork belly was okay as well--nothing particularly special.  Price: $30 before tax and tip is ridiculous. I'm a firm believer that no KBBQ spot (unless it's a la carte or marketed to be high-end) should be this expensive ESPECIALLY considering Let's Meat's limited menu.. This price point is purely a result of absolute lack of competition. Unfortunately, until there's pressure from competition, they'll have no incentive to make the price more reasonable. Moreover, the $13.99 extra for EACH plate of galbi is RIDICULOUS. A plate limit of 1 per customer would be much more reasonable at the very least.  Overall, while it's great that Charlotte has a KBBQ spot, the price and limited selection make it hard to justify coming back frequently. Come try them out for your first KBBQ experience but just know that there's much better out there!

mcOR-xFwUeYh2qyNc6BcnA.text: I may not be the best person to review the authenticity of the Korean BBQ but I can say that I enjoyed the experience overall mainly because it was a great venue to entertain a large group.  We had eight people so it was a full two tables.  I enjoyed the different meats and thought they were decent quality and the selection was solid with the options of Ribeye, chicken, shrimp, and pork belly.  All of it fresh but as you know you have to cook it yourself .  Overall a good experience but a little pricey for what you actually get and I probably will go back at some point but not for a while.  I also felt frustrated with the seasonings on the meat and a lot of times was missing out because I lack the experience with which Korean spices I like the best.  This issue left much of the meat sort of bland and forgettable which is a shame.   Value:  4/10 Service:  10/10 Food:  7/10 Ambiance:  8/10

yfoXtFS50dRn6tIijWIAaw.text: After seeing True Korean style BBQ places on TV shows, I've been really wanting to try this concept first hand! I was excited to hear about Let's Meat opening, but didn't get my chance to try it until after one of the Panther's games a few weeks back. Overall my wife and I had an amazing experience and certainly would recommend everyone getting out of their comfort zone and giving this a try!  Just to be clear, this concept is where you have a stove top in front of you and raw meats are brought to you for you to cook and enjoy with a cornucopia of sides. While my previous experiences of self cooking are more fondue style (not really fun for me), this is a bit different with the meats being really thinly sliced and an all-you-can-eat concept ordering while you go with a 2 hour window to enjoy the experience. I would recommend giving many things a try and realize that you will end up going meat heavy whether you plan to or not, so certainly plan to come hungry.   I'll also give a shout out to the service as both our waiter and manager were incredibly nice and helped us walk through (and even cooked) some of their favorites which certainly added to the experience. Also considering the atmosphere, I would recommend bringing a party of 4-6 here as it allows you to try everything without killing yourself. We certainly plan to be back and bring some friends and family with us for reinforcements.

evAg-NNPP0pRt4eoGVdzeg.text: I waited 4 years for Charlotte to get a KBBQ joint. An authentic one. So when I found out about this place - I knew this was where I was going for my Mother's Day dinner.   I called ahead and asked how long the wait time was - they told me about 20-30 minutes on the phone. However, when we arrived our wait time was less than 15 minutes.   I anticipated it being a flat $29.99 for all of us but they have an adjusted rate for kids $11.99 for under a certain age. I cannot remember the cut off now.   Once you are seated at the table, they will ask you if you are familiar with KBBQ. We are, so they didn't explain everything to us other than how they operate. You get to start with 3 choices of meats and then reorder as you like.   Some KBBQ will cook the meat for you and others you have to cook yourself. This one you have to cook yourself. This really gives the dining experience a fun vibe to it. Once you get familiar with what meats cook the fastest (fatty brisket), you can cook those first  and eat that while the other meats that take longer to cook are cooking.   I really enjoyed their banchan - it was a good assortment but what I didn't like is that if you wanted soup or the egg souffle you had to ask for it, they don't bring it out as part of the banchan assortment. The kimchi was good, very flavorful. I really enjoyed the tofu. It was properly seasoned - but it is served cold. I have had better potato salad at other KBBQ and we didn't even really touch theirs. It was quite bland.   The meat is good - the variety of choices is pretty standard. We did not try all the marinated meats because the more marinated meats you cook, the stickier your grill gets, the smokier it gets and well that is no fun. And the marinated pork belly that we did try, wasn't super flavorful anyways - so we stuck with the plain.   It is loud here. I mean very loud. SUPER LOUD. The music is so loud, so people are talking loud just so you can hear and it's just LOUD. My son kept complaining and I can understand why.   The staff was amazing. They were friendly, helpful and on point. We will definitely be back. I love KBBQ.  And I should have taken more photos but I was busy cooking and eating. Oops.

maN9vpcYgLDoEi-zZE6Lvg.text: First time to Charlotte and wanted to try some local venues. Found this on Yelp and so glad I did!   The con: they don't take reservations. The pro: the wait wasn't long at all! They are really attentive and make sure you stay loaded with meats and rice! The service is great!  The meats are amazing. Such a wide variety to choose from everyone will be happy! The price is reasonable for the variety you can can choose from that it's a great place to go have a group dinner and socialize!

ncFK1YSowmiMavVXnBkmZQ.text: Are you hungry?  Then go here!  It's all you can eat for 2 hours depending on the wait (they won't make you leave early) and let's be serious, if you're eating for 2 hours you're either a competitive eater or REALLY enjoying this place.  They have a great assortment of beef dishes to try as well as pork belly.  There are 8 different kinds of pork belly, of which I had the lemon garlic & curry.  I also had multiple servings of bulgogi and the fatty brisket.  You have to get the brisket, it cools quickly and goes very well in a lettuce wrap.  Bring a whole crew of people here as the environment is great for gatherings, parties, or just a group of hungry people.  I can not recommend this place highly enough, it's in my top 3 favorite places here to eat in Charlotte

Gd_qgakgbJyYXIqiqN6ZjQ.text: I love Korean BBQ and used to enjoy it at least once a month in NYC's K-town. Let's Meat Kbbq was very comparable to the foods that I had in NY. The portions are plentiful and flavors were bold.   I would highly recommend this place for a couple or a large group.

xDQbY4ny5MCI46EbTINMAA.text: Came back here couple of time recently. I feel like the quality of the meat going down hill. The fatty beef brisket is really good and fresh. But we order rib eye steak and pork belly, the color of the meat looks different from my previous visit. They don't look fresh, not sure how long they keep their meet. Additionally, the steak also taste a little sour without any dipping sauce. The side dishes not fresh neither, kimchi, potatoes salad taste different from my previous visit and look greasy. It happened couple of times in my recent visit, Safe to say will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

NLRhHRcqlkaL6ys5jBi5Ug.text: Finally Charlotte has a Korean BBQ. Food is great, experience is fun, atmosphere casual and loud. The servers are all quite friendly and eager to help first timers.   They don't have a full bar. Wish they'd add one. And note this is a fixed price menu, tagging along to nibble on something with a group isn't really an option here. Go hungry. They give you a two hour time limit, but honestly I don't see how anyone could possibly have an issue with that given you start getting your food and cooking it up at your table almost immediately upon being seated.   I wish they'd dim the lights. I find it entirely too bright.  Other than that and adding a full bar I think they've nailed it and added a new cuisine that Charlotte needed for a long time!

GOmGtl043g4dO-1AO5GWOQ.text: This is my first time eating Korean BBQ and it was fabulous!  It's an all you can eat in 2 hours and it was great!  I love how we eat the food right out of the stove!  So hot and fresh and the bulgogi is nicely marinated where I didn't even need any sauce.  The meats were definitely nice and fresh.  It's a fun atmosphere along with fine dining.

twbZKsTJSxVgDhAZBUpcIA.text: This was honestly one of the best meals I've had in a while. There are tons of neat, delicious, places to eat around the Queen City, but Let's Meat KBBQ is definitely in the top tier.  We arrived at the restaurant around 8:30 Saturday night and they said it would be about a thirty to forty minute wait before we could be seated. Not ideal, but it was the weekend and the place was packed. Undeterred we decided to walk up the block to Unknown Brewery to kill some time and were happily surprised to get our "ready to be seated" text earlier than expected (maybe twenty five minutes?). We made our way back and were promptly shown to our table.  Walking past the counter in to the dining area you can really appreciate the look of the place. Super simple, super clean, just enough character. The walls are about 80% just plain white stone, but there are a few super colorful Asian themed murals scattered about. One wall (right behind our table) also had a projector with what seemed to be a little how to video for the tabletop grills. The seating itself and the table dividers are unstained clear coated wood and the tables seem to be granite with a just bigger than dinner plate sized flat top grill in the middle.   We were quickly greeted by our wonderful waiter Green (yes like the color) who took our drink orders and began to explain the menu and process for ordering and cooking everything. Our drinks came out quickly along with all the accouterments for the meal. Salad, perfectly cooked rice, Kim chi, no less than four different sauces, radish, corn cheese bowls, marinated tofu, lettuce wraps and a few different sprouts. They really want to make sure you have options once the meat hits the table, and hit the table it did.  We tried so many wonderful things it's hard to keep track of it all. We started with the Standard Pork Belly. If you like a nice fatty piece of bacon this will be heaven for you, and since you're in charge of cooking your own food, you can make it as just as crispy as you want. (We also tried the garlic pork belly and wine pork belly!) Then it was time for the Spicy Chicken. Really flavorful but honestly not as good as their other options. The True gems though were of the cow variety. The Fatty Beef Brisket was outstanding. Super thin slices of wonderfully marbled meat, just sear, dip and enjoy. It was almost like if you took the thinly sliced/shaved meat off of a philly cheesesteak and dipped it into a world of wonderful Korean flavors.  I thought it couldn't get any better than the brisket, then we ordered the Beef Bulgogi. Oh boy. You can't go wrong with any of the items we tried, but the Beef Bulgogi is something you can sit down and get lost in the flavor of, and easily lose track of how much you've eaten. It's sort of similar to the brisket in appearance, thin (though not super thin) pieces of meat, but you can tell the difference in smell as soon as it hits the grill. The Bulgogi is marinated in a variation of the house sauce (one of the four you get with all your sides and things) and it is so damn delicious. I'm not sure if the meat is just more tender from the marinade, or the sauce really is just that delicious, but I could order nothing save for that one item and be perfectly happy. Those tiny pieces of beef are truly worth the price of admission.  This dinner was such a wonderful experience. Green always kept our drinks full, made sure our food always came out quickly and had no problem providing some friendly chit-chat along the way. I haven't had an overall dining experience this pleasant in some time. I imagine some might be turned off by the price but it really is worth every penny. The amount and quality of food provided, along with the wonderful staff and atmosphere makes this place a real treasure. Please, do yourself a favor and come visit this place. You will be so glad you did.
