xik2MTbBg6YN5nbZ9TNmcg.text: I love it here! I am glad I decided to come after reading mixed reviews. The food is amazing. Our waiter was very helpful as it was our first time. He gave us recommendations and guided us as we cooked our own food. The bulgogi was my favorite. I tried tongue for the first time and actually enjoyed it. You have a two hour limit but i was so full and didn't even worry about hitting the time limit. Whenever you order anything it comes out extremely quick so you can take your time eating and not worry about waiting for new food items to come back. They don't take reservations so I recommend going early.

Y6ryzTk4Ne6lBXZFJ6rS_g.text: Korean BBQ has always been one of my favorite meal experiences. It's fun when it's done well and Let's Meat does KBBQ GREAT.  I've been a huge fan of Seoul Food next door since I moved to Charlotte so when I heard they were opening up a sister kbbq place RIGHT BESIDE Seoul, I got super excited. I thought, "How could this not be a slam dunk?"   I was right.  LET'S MEAT IS FREAKIN AWESOME. I'm sure everything I've said has been said before so I'll keep this short.  First of all, they have a rotating slideshow on the wall that helps put a word to everything you'll see throughout your meal. That's sides and meats. Very helpful!  It's $30 for AYCE and my god can you feast at this place. Our server was bringing meat out at record pace and was extremely helpful since it was our first time there.  The sides they bring you are all delicious, the salad, the rice, the cheese corn. It's ALL good.   Favorite cuts of meat were the bulgogi and the thinly sliced pork. Garlic pork wasn't too great, way fatty and not a ton of flavor. Everything else was spot on, though. If you've got a group of 4 or 6 and you're all wanting to do something a little different then the usual sushi or gastropub thing, Let's Meat is a really fun experience you'll all enjoy. And get super full.

Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States. Before the carnage - clean cooking surface and menu

XreHtCEHicyUcJJL4FG15w.text: Had my first Korean BBQ experience here last night. I went with my mom and my boyfriend and it was all actually our first time having Korean BBQ and we were very excited for the experience. They have a great selection of sides and sauces, sesame oil, chilis, tofu, daikon etc. I really enjoyed the salad they offered with spicy seasoning over it. It went perfectly to wrap up the meat in.   They have a pretty good selection of meat, the portions of the pork and brisket were way too much for me though. They should serve smaller trays of that (only because you get charged for waste). The only reason I'm docking two stars is because of our service.   Our waitress was rude to my mom and lacked decorum. She was indifferent and passed by our table maybe twice to chop up some meat for us. Other than that, we had to flag her down when we needed something.

kawPs-dDN1rEV5wy75qCGA.text: My wife and I wanted to try this place out as we haven't had any experience with Korean food. We decided to go on a late afternoon on a Sunday. The wait was about 45 minutes for us, but that's more due to the amount of time it takes to actually eat here.   This is an order, cook your own food, order some more, repeat the cycle style restaurant. They have a great selection of meats to choose from and although they had several sides, we didn't eat many. The meat was the main attraction and it was awesome!  Our waiter was great at explaining everything to us and also helping us get started. We had the pork belly and the brisket to start off. Both were amazing. Then we tried the squid, bulgogi and soy chicken. Those were also very good. We ended it with some shrimp and more pork belly. The brisket was my favorite overall.   There are a variety of sauces that they bring you to go with the meats. I liked 2 out of the 4. The lettuce we ordered to go with the meats were also enjoyable. There are videos playing at the front and in the main dinning area that explain how to cook and eat the food. By the time we left, we felt like pros.   It's all you can eat, so bring your appetite!

p2i6H-dOLMBCvTjvE6ZmrQ.text: **BEWARE** You have to cook your own food.Lol  With that being said. I have never been to a Korean bbq so I wasn't sure what to expect.. Overall I wish I would've waited to the hype dies down. For Saturday, it was 1.5 hrs wait. By the time I got seated I was hangry and about to die of thirst. Zah was a lot of help. He tried to explain the whats and how's but due to the music being sooo loud and I left my hearing aids at home. So It's a lost cause. Lucky my cousin took over. So here's my overall view:   FOOD: 4/5 some are good and some is a miss. The Kim Chi was a yum and I have never been a fan of those.. tofu was a nooo. I'm confuse. The curry meat was ok..  SERVICE: 5/5 Zah (waiter) and David aka manager tried to help us cook the food. But it was overwhelmingly busy so they were hoping from table to table.  AMBIANCE: 3/5 I understand it's a Saturday night. But I feel like overall cooking the meats is a good place to socialize with your friends. So with the music being sooo loud, it drown out our conversations. So we don't have a choice but to eat and nods at each other for whatever is being said and hope that's the right nod!   Special NOTE: there's a 2 hrs limit per table. From what Zah said. It's more like a courtesy thing for the next customers. You don't want to sit, eat and marinate (socialize) when there's a whole line of ppl waiting. I understand that.  But when I look at these type of set up. I wouldn't want to be rush. Cooking and socializing with friends goes together. Just my thought! So I'll keep that 2 hrs limit in mind the next time I dine here. If I want to really socialize with the girls. This place wouldn't be my choices

UlmZCgg0AneATfqdov-jpg.text: What a fun experience, and the food was awesome too! :) came here late on a Friday night and I have only good things to say about the overall experience. The servers were extremely friendly and eager to explain how it all worked, as well as make recommendations since it was our first time eating Korean bbq! We tried the chicken, shrimp, veggies and some pork options as well. All the dipping sauces and the banchan were great! And the sides were delicious - tried the egg Souffle and soup. Can not wait to return. Though a little pricey, it's well worth it. I love their policy of charging you 10% more if you over order and waste the food (since taking home the leftovers is not an option). I'm excited about this new addition to south end! Go in with an empty stomach, and enjoy the experience!

m5cj2qPHThyFf6EmxYpOrw.text: I will be the first to confess I didn't know the first thing about Korean BBQ but I quickly learned I liked it a lot ! So it was different because I didn't understand the concept at first but when I heard the two phrases unlimited and two hours I said challenge accepted!   I didn't know you could get double and triple meat !!! I quickly learned how to cook the food and the service was super fast and friendly!   I truly enjoyed how the manager came by and cooked the food for us as we learned lemon wasn't used for flavor but rather cleaning the grill. I enjoyed everything from the vegetables to the triple Korean BBQ slices and more.   The options were more limited but you could get brown or white rice. I tried some green stuff that I forgot the name but was really good. Please try this place as I believe it is a lot more fun with a group of ppl between 4 and 12 people.   It is fun when everyone is laughing and enjoy good eats! Great concept and I look forward to bringing all my friends here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

2tYuY2HQIZIcdp2tsUS5eg.text: A modern and clever way to do all you can eat Korean barbeque. At Let's Meat Kbbq, there is a flat rate for you to eat all your heart desires but it is structured in a way that decreases the potential for unnecessary waste. So essentially, the idea is that you order from a menu for portions of things whether it be meat, vegetables, soups, etc and if you want more, you can always order more. Honestly, some people might not be excited about the "inconvenience" about ordering multiple times but I'm happy with it because I've oftentimes wondered and reflected about the waste! Also, the waiters/waitresses are so attentive that anytime you need anything, they're right there to take your order. Furthermore, they do all the cooking for you, so all you need to do is eat. The only thing that I wasn't crazy about was the fact that the price per person is already pretty steep. It seems a little ridiculous to have to pay an additional amount for some of the meats. I won't speak much to the authenticity. I didn't particularly think the meats were flavored well though the bean paste soup was exactly as how I remember my mother making it when I was a wee lass. Lastly, I was really glad that their kimchi was good- it's the first thing I look for when I go to a Korean restaurant.

E5UXnCqSK1zSmV0SxAeOrA.text: I Loved It Was So Much Fun And Everyone Was So Nice The Service Was Quick And The Servers Helped When I Needed It They Didn't Hover And Make Things Awkward. This Is The Best Place I've Been So Far Since I Have Lived In The City.

J_o_4n72ipDn3E02REoSYw.text: Nice atmosphere. Super friendly service. It was our waitress' first night and she did great. The managers were very friendly and helpful as well.  Food is great! Lots of options. The bulgolgi beef is my favorite as well as the curry pork.  Make sure you try all the little side dishes they bring out. Lots of good flavors that I've never had before. Some of it looks weird but all of them have different flavors that are on point.

-p9lCMDco7hz_rg-hEJ_vg.text: It was first time eating Korean Barbecue and the experience was everything I thought it would be and then some. The all you can eat meat was wonderful and the sides added to the experience. Never had seaweed salad until my visit and far exceeded expectations. When I get a chance I will have to take my girlfriend to enjoy the experience.

EzbjeH82YrvkERvlWzFLdw.text: I was skeptical at first bc ever one says you have to cook your own food and paying to cook my own food doesn't sit well with me.  After we were sat we were quickly greeted by Peter and he took all of the confusion away!  Not only was he very helpful in making decisions but he cooked all of the options we chose and they were delicious!  We started out simply ordering the Pork Belly and Brisket. After that we told Peter to surprise us and that he did!  The Beef Chunks are by far the best thing we had along with the traditional Bulgogi.  Great place to bring out of town friends or just something different for your dinner option.  Loved it and will return!

Mr2copl3As6zSnBvT74bKg.text: Went here a week ago.  Luckily the wait wasn't too long and I was waiting for my friends to arrive anyway.  We sat and ordered little by little.  All of a sudden a server sipped a dropped the meat in my friend's water and some fell on the table.  We didn't make a big deal about it as these types of things happen.  The bulgogi Beef, chicken and the pork butt were all fantastic! The manager came over and spoke to us and we enjoyed everything.  We look forward to the menu expanding! Great food and service!

dVcZy27AAlekH4Zy5mFAcg.text: First Korean BBQ place in Charlotte, finally!!! Been waiting for it! Marinated meats are good! King mushroom was fresh and clean. Staff are friendly and accommodating! We will definitely visit again!

TwrjFZbCuYcGmoPAXg_J7A.text: Owned by the same people at Seoul Food. Love the atmosphere, food, and drinks! Prices are great and our sever was the sweetest, funniest girl!

Xrd98tV-OWLpHJZKmD8QTw.text: Food and service is AMAZING!! If Korean BBQ is new to you, No worries they'll walk you through step by step. The food is delicious!!

bFKPg9xvEfpdIFpylpcC-w.text: Their food was delicious and the staff was very helpful. I would definitely say it's more fun to go with a group of at least 4 so you can try all different things. The meat they brought at the end was the absolute best so don't immediately fill up at the beginning.

KlNPeGvom1opYXEvp6ZyMg.text: Our experience was great!! For their second day being open, we are very impressed. We had no idea what we were doing and every single staff member came to help us!! The fatty beef brisket, thinly sliced beef and corn cheese were our favorites! The  manager was super friendly and helpful and made us feel welcomed and at home. Definitely take your time and try everything, we will be back! Lee Lee and David really made our experience amazing, thank you guys!

b-7BXQt6Y6hc4VRnfwqwdg.text: Ok so Let's Meat, and we did indeed. This was our first time to this AYCE KBBQ joint. I liked the decor of the place it was definitely different for me but a cool modernist look to it. The Parking "at least when we went it was a Thursday night" stunk cause there was none we waited for parking for about 15mins... But peeps it was like that cause this place was PACKED!!! Why? Cause people wanted to MEAT!!! Once we were seated we got a new guy he was only there for about a week and he was Excellent he taught us how to use the grill and best ways to cook the different meats, to recommending dishes and what sauces to use. So I bet the rest of the crew was on point as well. Ok ok the food is what we need to get to. EXCELLENT!!! Great choices of great quality meats and veggies awesome sauces, which were literally "Awesome Sauce" that's we're the word came from. And boy was I happy with every aspect that I experienced there. Worth the wait for parking and getting a table. Go Try and let me know what u taught (thought)!!!

UXvdkOp99sX2-FARtNIK4Q.text: So in Charlotte for my husband and I's six year anniversary. We thought we would do a nice fun day at Carowinds, and Charlotte!  Arrived a bit late to Charlotte and thought before heading to our Airbnb we would stop somewhere to do dinner. This place popped up on our yelp search and we thought we would give it a go since it had good reviews, was new, and near where we were staying. So glad we did! Absolutely no wait time which was great, and the waitress was super nice, telling us suggestions, and helping us out when she could tell we we're struggling. The price was 29.99 per person which was a bit pricy, but was basically all you could eat for two hours! We started out with pork belly and pork, with veggies and rice. It comes with like a sampler plate which had kimchi, picked radish,  potato salad, seaweed with red sauce as well as bean shoots and tons of other little sides, also had a yummy salad.  We then got bogogi, and shrimp.. by this time we were full! Our waitress gave us a hard time for tapping out early, but I think we did pretty good for two people who didn't plan on doing kbbq. Overall an awesome place for a date night, or a hangout with a group of buddies. I love kbbq it's such a fun and unique experience!!!

FsrMuS4DgZCa0Qge1slWBQ.text: After a day golfing with friends, we decided to come try this new place. I've been to many Korean BBQ restaurants in NYC and KBBQs hosted by my friends; therefore, I couldn't wait try this place out! 5 out of 6 of us came here to get a table, but we had to wait for our 6th friend to come in order for them to seat us. Keep in mind that your whole party has to be there before you can be seated. We all decided to get a bowl of white rice to have as a base with all the food we were about to order. It is $30 a person and all you can eat. If you don't finish all the food or if too much is left over, they will charge you an extra 10%... which is reasonable. Parties of 6 or more has a automatic gratuity of 15%. Your party also has a limit of 2 hours at the table. Our waiters name was Bryan, he was amazing! He had some great suggestions and we ordered everything he recommended. Ran back and forth to us because we were, indeed, needy. He still remained attentive and looked like he enjoyed serving us (even if that probably wasn't the case haha). Water was always refilled before it was empty which speaks wonders with how much I drank! Attached is a picture of our receipt. P.S. Get the beef bulgogi. We ate 12 orders of that.... SO GOOD!

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

k99IvAwW19rLkE2J_Jbi9w.text: 5/21/2018,    My husband Adrian & I (Jackie) went for the first time to Let's Meat KBBQ. Let me start off by saying; what a phenomenal eating experience and ambiance! They were playing EDM that day and we love EDM! We absolutely loved Misaki, she was so knowledgeable about the menu and recommended delicious menu items! She had us try Seju (Soju in English) and it was amazing! She was so sweet and was training another waitress there named Zina (you have a good teacher Zina). Kara, the restaurant manager, frequently checked on us and we kept assuring her that everything was great! All in all, I recommend this place to anyone that loves some good korean food. I will say the only downside is not many items to choose from yet (as we were assured more items will come in the future), but definitely worth the atmosphere and customer service you receive. We will definitely be making repeat visits. Hope you all get to experience what we experienced!

T0uRkMkK5yFKTDmu-wo9PQ.text: Let's Meat was a lot of fun. I would highly recommend this restaurant for large groups but not for an intimate date. It was very loud and honestly quite over priced. Pork, beef tips, chicken and shrimp are not that expensive and there is honestly no way a normal human being can eat $30.00 worth of food. I got a small bottle of raspberry wine which was truly disappointing. Although I should have assumed it was going to be sweet it was honestly not potable and I had to get 80% of the bottle to go. We had fun and the food was truly delicious but I do think this will be a once in a very blue moon experience considering the price.

LtT2aWC-ozeLHgq681x37g.text: FINALLLLLLLY  CHARLOTTE HAS REAL KOREAN BBQ  we have prayed for it and demanded it for years on in. Tired of driving 3.5 hours to atlanta to get some real Korean bbq. It has arrived and it's nothing short of greatness for that kbbq fix. All you can eat meat and sides for less than 30 bucks. The only down fall that I can say they have as of right now is not opening for lunch but it's still new so kinks are expected. Plus there's a lot of hype and excitement with it so there is gonna be a wait for a table, but it is worth the wait. If you've never had Korean bbq you are missing out on True flavor greatness. Something about cooking your meat and taking it right off the grill cooked at your own person preference  and cramming it  into your mouth one bite at a time is simply perfection lol "caution don't burn your tongue " all the flavors that you expect on the meat marinades and sides are all there. Let's meat kbbq did a really good job at not leaving nothing out, and doing it the right way for Charlotte. I been a vegetarian for a few months now and I broke that just for this! Welcome to Charlotte and welcome to North Carolina Korean bbq! The Home of american bbq where eastern bbq and western bbq sauce as been battling out on who's sauce is better. Sorry Carolinians KOREAN BBQ JUST WON THE TITLE! I recommend you going right at 4:30 to guarantee a table, if not, you gonna get tired of waiting for one bc they stay busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

EI1Bq2fYufO4rsDktpyLUg.text: I came to eat here about a month ago, they have a few rules such as; you can only stay for a maximum of 2 hours, you can't take food to go, and it's $30 per person but that's for all you can eat so depending on who you are it may or may not be a good deal for you. My server was very nice and a few other servers I spoke to were also nice and friendly. I love the bulgogi and pork meat. This is a place you have to try at least once, if you don't know what you're doing the server helps you and will even stand at your table and cook the meat for you.

Ggx6xf5wl8jFpEZZfEktKw.text: Went here last night for their grand opening and was surprised at how authentic it is. They are located at south end of Charlotte next to their sister restaurant Seoul Food Meat Co. Parking was a little tight so you may have to do some walking which was no problem to me. They had murals with an Asian Zen and their setup was very modern with wooden benches and coffee colored marble tables with, of course, a deep stove in the middle to cook your foods. This isn't my first time having Korean BBQ so I was wondering how their setup and food would taste. It's an all you can eat $30.00 a person and $12.00 for kids ages 4-10 with a 2-hour limit. That's understandable since the place is a bit small so they don't need people hanging around when others are waiting. They have a great selection of domestic and local beers plus Korean soju! They don't have a big meat selection yet but it's KBBQ so the basics are just beef and pork, if you ever had KBBQ before. They have a variety of side dishes and I love Korean side dishes, especially kimchi and their kimchi was great! Bryan was our waiter and he was welcoming and very tentative even though they were slammed. I had a great time and ate as much as I can - I was feeling the itis after LOL. I will definitely come back and can't wait for more selections on their menu. Continue the great work guys! This will probably be a successful Korean BBQ in Charlotte.

8t-61oqD8Ru3F6XH-FjW0g.text: This place is honesty the best Korean bbq in North Carolina! From variety of meats, great service, high quality meats etc. honestly with a group of friends, you would enjoy for sure. The meat wasn't frozen and served to order, it's spacious and gives a welcoming feeling. As far as service, it was really good, my waiter was attentive and nice. I had lower expectations but this place blew my mind! Definitely recommend.

C6_h-ntkACjix25tstKr7w.text: I would recommend going with no more than 4 people in your party. Otherwise you are going to be constantly waiting for more food to come to the table. I loved all of their fermented side items, especially the tofu! Everything was absolutely delicious and well flavored. I'd recommend the cold noodles, mushrooms, and the lemon pepper pork belly!

KTGc_Oa4dffqCO0BRpk29w.text: Great food, great service. Servers are supper attentive even when packed. Definitely have to check it out!

jTFDOsJDP573nxH0qJWk-g.text: This is what we've been waiting for - Moving down from California we were sad to notice that North Carolina didn't have KBBQ, at least the grill in front of you type not the food type. This place has good options nothing to special though, but the customer service here is spectacular. Occasionally forgot one or two things we order but they are really packed most of the time.

hU9sVqDG_68y2Pn1DOJ9Gw.text: Great food and service.   I thought I wouldn't be a fan of cooking my own food but it's really an experience and the staff is very helpful.

5MvwmcJ9K9MH73OqyAqlpw.text: Coming from California and not finding a KBBQ place in Charlotte I was really excited when this place opened. Sadly, I wasn't that impressed. If you've had KBBQ elsewhere then you'd know this place is considered mediocre. The bulgolgi was way too sweet, and the options for pork and chicken are limited. Why is the only pork option pork belly? Granted, various flavors but, still just pork belly. Even then beef options are limited. $30 is also very high for kbbq. I've eaten KBBQ in Korea towns and in upscale neighborhoods in various states and NEVER paid $30 per person. The most I've ever paid was $25 for dinner and $20 for lunch at a place that had a way better menu selection (tons of choices) and the food was amazing. And those prices were considered high! So you know $30 is ridiculous. I think they get away with charging this much because so far they're the only location Charlotte. Had it been the best KBBQ I've ever had then I honestly wouldn't have minded the price. When the food is worth the price no one minds paying. If you've never experienced KBBQ before then you may enjoy this place as your introduction into KBBQ. If you have, you won't be impressed (as other yelpers have also noted). I gave two stars because the customer service was good. But, I won't be back. Hoping another KBBQ place opens in Charlotte soon. Until then I will drive to Atlanta or fly somewhere if the craving hits me bad enough.

ce3dG-JR3C1WK8onLFFcnw.text: Just tried LET's MEAT!  Waiting at the door for them to open!!  We were so excited!  We moved here from Los Angeles and have missed Korean BBQ!!  Wished someone would open one here in Charlotte!  And they did!!  We were not disappointed..  Great food!!  Great service!!. Our server, name pronounced GREEN, was excellent!  Very attentive, professional and very nice!  Everyone there was very attentive and nice as well! No complaints whatsoever. I meant to take a photo of our food, but once it was brought to our table, I just needed to EAT!!!  Was soooo looking forward to this and now feel full and happy!!! Cool, casual vibe.   By the time we left, the place was already filling up!!  Good sign!  We are going back tomorrow with my mom!! Two VERY enthusiastic thumbs up!!  Photo is after we scarfed down our delicious meal!!

There is an appeal to the all you can eat idea but we just prefer Pepero (in Stallings) and the Korean food at the counter at the Super G. Certainly the Let's Meat atmosphere is better than these two places and Let's Meat is a good place to introduce someone to Korean food. Service has been excellent at Let's Meat. The banchan are fine - nothing wrong at all. But Pepero just seems better. If you are going with a crowd and some folks are new to Korean food, I think Let's Meat is a good choice. If you already like Korean food and are less concerned about aesthetics, there are other choices.

mFsRUDRT_WTGhNLmu9k3CQ.text: I came here with a handful of friends and we all had our eyes set for Korean bbq. This place didn't disappoint. As a preface, this place was next to another Korean place and between the two restaurants there were no parking places nearby. The private lot was full, the street lots were filled at least two streets down, and it was a struggle to find anywhere that wasn't paid lots that were also rare. It wasn't necessary their fault but it also reflects how good the place was.  Regardless, the place had a modern feel when we entered and we got seated quickly once we arrived. The server we had explained the menu and offered to help us cook the foods until we got used to it, but it got rather busy so we never took him up on it. You could only order 3 meats at a time and unlimited sides, which worried me because of the size of our party made it so I didn't think we can cook and eat our fill within their 2 hour limit. Fortunately the food we requested came quickly and timely, hardly a wait as we cooked and ordered. In the end our group of 5 just hit 2 hours when we reached our fill so I'm glad about that.   We ordered essentially everything on the menu that wasn't the extra charge add on option and we came to the consensus that the beef bulgogi and beef chunks tasted the best. I personally liked the butter squid but that might not suit everyone's tastes. The beef tongue was also good as a third option but near the end of the dinner we primarily got the beef bulgogi and chunks. My friends and I agreed this place was worth the trip and money, left relatively pleased, and will most likely come again when in the area.

HFbVooJDjpsnskAQldfPtw.text: It's great to see a True Korean restaurant come into Charlotte. The staff is awesome and the food is great.  Just wish the meat would come marinated already.

vJTqgWIStJ3biexNhNkVYQ.text: Came here for a friends birthday with a large group....while we had to wait a bit longer than quoted for seating it was well worth the wait. I asked our server if there was any fish sauce used in any of the sauces he said he wasn't sure but he would check...after about 10min he returned to confirm that there was indeed fish sauce in one of the dipping sauces on the table but only after I asked again(I have a severe seafood allergy). The food was plentiful and fresh and I really enjoyed the ability to cook the meat yourself. They will continue to bring you food for the duration of your stay which is great. I would highly recommend trying this place out.

r_GfOKf5TP6vx553XGN4sw.text: As an avid KDrama watcher, it's always been a desire of mine to eat Kbbq. Like I've seen it done on TV... cook at the table... all of that...but sadly there wasn't an option in Charlotte for me to try it out. I was STOKED when I learned of this new restaurant and immediately dragged my son to go test it out! I was not disappointed!! Our waiter was attentive, helpful and patiently taught us all the tricks (thanks Steven!). The meat was delicious. We had 2 servings of beef brisket, pork belly, garlic pork belly, squid and beef Bulgogi! The banchan was plentiful and quickly replenished. It wasn't a cheap trip, but it was definitely worth it to a newbie like me. Next time, I'll come with some grown ups so I can knock another item off my kdrama bucket list ... SOJU AND MAKGEOLLI. I'll definitely be back! What a fun place!  Oh yeah... gotta say one semi negative thing... the gyeran jjim?  (egg souffle )  not the best I've had...I was introduced to this delightful dish at a Korean restaurant in Cleveland (of all places, lol) it was sooo delicious and unique to me that I scoured the internet to learn how to make it myself. The version I prefer (and that i make) is light and fluffy. Silky, almost like custard, but not pudding-y, with almost no broth.  Theirs was like soft scrambled eggs in chicken soup. The flavor was good, it was definitely tasty, but it wasn't what I was looking forward to. All said, this is DEFINITELY a place you want to try out!! Loved it!!!

rQboisthCI0uppenYFqMuQ.text: If you are looking for an all-you-can eat place, this is it! It was a fine experience. We went on a busy night which, in retrospect, they are all fairly busy. However, we went with 8 people; we told the host we would prefer to sit together as we had seen multiple tables with two areas to cook. We ended up sitting at two separate tables and when we asked if could wait to sit together, we were told "either sit here or nothing, those are saved". Needless to say, it threw us and we sat. We had two different servers and no option to mingle. The food was good and the staff was efficient but you can tell they are not working for their money and just going through the motions. Semi-rude and with a set price, our server seem to just expect a certain amount. We ordered alcohol and extras but that didn't seem to change their mindset. Overall, I probably would go back, firm believer in second and maybe third changes, but it would be with a small group and now my expectations are lower so there is less room for disappointment.

XLvk1ebrtT_yJHepEFPOJA.text: Um, let's just say that after I went here I now have dreams of eating the delicious buttered squid all over again. This place had a wonderful atmosphere, fun staff, and amazing food!

The shrimp and the belly fat was also good.   For the price you pay it's definitely worth it. I was full but not overly full. I would definitely come back again!!

O1OxzQiq8I-hEgvMZfeCFw.text: Since I never experienced kbbq before, my sidekick decided this would be a fun dinner outing for us. There was a 6-30 min wait time for a table, but luckily for us, we only waited about 6 minutes. Our sever was very nice, funny, helpful, and just a touch OCD (which I loved). Our table stayed cleared of unused dishes, she came by and made sure our grill was fine and that our drinks was filled. Since it was my first time, she recommended foods for me to try. I've ordered the pork belly, spicy chicken, ribeyed steak, I loved the spicy chicken and ribeye. They were seasoned so well. I sampled all the sides, and enjoyed the kimchi the most. My sidekick enjoyed his meal and tried to do the cooking. Fortunately, I know how to cook, unlike him, so I made sure our food wasn't over or undercooked. I would love to come back and try everything else.

FizzdIwxm5pLEbRlDrm-3g.text: Finally! An AYCE Korean BBQ joint in Charlotte. Located right beside Seoul Kitchen which is our usual go-to when visiting this city, I was very excited to know Let's Meat has finally opened since my pervious visit. We arrived around 5:30-6 p.m.  and there was zero wait which is the norm for Korean BBQ places, peak time like 7 p.m. is the time to beat when dining at an AYCE. The hostess was very pleasant and sat our party rather quickly.   The menu was standard with items that I've seen in other menus before but the flavor of the meats were out of this world! It seems like they took their time marinating them before serving. I was a fan of the minimal portion size, it gave us a chance to try almost everything on the menu. Variety of options for the banchan (sides) the one that stuck out for the the most were the bean sprouts, tofu, and kimchi. The potato salad tasted a little bland and could use more flavor. I was a fan of the corn cheese as well!   Our server was very attentive and had great energy. The place itself was good in size and had plenty of seating. The price was a bit high but worth it for the pleasant experience I had. I will definitely be back here when I'm back in Charlotte!

esqgaZDJD0fQ8-THAcnuIA.text: Wow! My review is officially #102!  The scene: it's Saturday afternoon and we're tired of waiting for a table at Seoul Food Meat Co. right next door.  I sneak out and call Let's Meat - "We have a table but you need to come right now."  Me: "Done and done", as I trot thorough the door. I felt like I had won the lottery because I've heard the wait times can be longggg.  Since there have been 101 hundred reviews, I'm going to give you the Yelp Cliff Notes.  1) This place is a lot of fun - great place for groups and/or a celebration  2) The food is really good - the meats/proteins are high quality - the banchan (Koreans sides are awesome)  3) Adults $30 per person - kids 4-10 $12 - there's a two hour limit but that's plenty of time  4) The staff are great - super quick on the draw - they use headsets to speed orders along and to communicate with each other  5) They will bring you three meats/proteins at a time - and bring you more and more - ALL YOU CAN EAT (but not waste)  6) They serve Beer but it's on the pricey side  $5-10 range for bottles/cans  7) The small print at the bottom of the menu = for parties of 6 or more there will be an 18% service charge  We had a blast (even though we did have to cook our own food) - they even cleaned our grill and replaced it with another at one point. Super cool place!

O49tIaZRp_rZMV0CGNee5A.text: Boyfriend and I went here to celebrate 6 months and it did not let us down! We made the rookie mistake of trying to eat fast since they give you 2 hours, but honestly we were stuffed within 30 minutes. Definitely pace yourself, ask questions, and try everything!!

8dNIv6qLlexvxaAisRFc5A.text: My two sisters and our husbands decided to come out for one of their birthday dinners. I was very excited to try the only all you can eat KBBQ in NC. I've always had to travel further for this, so it's wonderful that we finally have one closer.  The first round of meats that we ordered was pork belly, bugolgi, and squid. The portions are small; one strip of pork belly and a small cup of squid. I know it's all you can eat, but it was pretty much one bite a piece until we ordered the next round. My brother in law mentioned to the server that we'd like more at one time, and he hooked us up. If it was two or three people at the table, it would have been different, and enough. So they stayed laying out the meats. So good and delic!! Full of flavor and the stone top grilled it perfectly.  It did take a while for each session to cook.. not sure if the gas was going out on the grill top or if the burner wasn't getting hot. The server had to keep messing with it. Other than that, our server, Green, was very wonderful!

dwcMSdT15NHBj8_akI7V0w.text: So my boyfriend and I decided to stop by Let's Meat for our first try at Korean BBQ! While there is a 2 hour limit with their all you can eat meats/sides, you can still do a lot of damage in that time frame. From the pork belly to the ribeye all of the meats were delicious and top quality. As for sides I was pretty #basic and stuck with white rice and veggies while my boyfriend got the egg souffle and cheesy corn.  My only issue was that our waiter did not let us do the one thing you would expect a Korean BBQ spot let you do - COOK YOUR OWN FOOD! Every time that the meats came to the table she would pop up and throw them on the grill for us. At first I thought that she would just do this for the first meat to show us the ropes, but she continuously came by every few minutes to flip the meat for us. Eventually I grabbed the tongs before she had the chance to and when she came to the table she reached for them anyway. After the 4th or so serving of meat, I asked if it would be alright if we cooked it ourselves. She said "ok" and let me start to cook the meat, but still came back a few minuets later and took the tongs to flip it some more. It was annoying, but I was not in the mood to get into a tug-of-war over a pair of tongs lol.   So overall the food was great, but we didn't get to have the experience that we came for. Looking at her with other tables she did the same thing while other waiters were more laid back. I heard one waiter specifically say "I'm just here if you need any help, but cooking it on your own is a part of the experience!" I wish that our waiter had gotten that memo...

3tTGJ5M8yJSZvXrp4nsMPA.text: For those of you who are looking for an amazing Korean meal, Let's Meat Kbbq is your place! Let's Meat is an All You Eat Korean Feast with all the staples including Bulgogi, Pork Belly, Beef Tongue, Kimchi and so much more.  Along with the meat selection they have a variety of vegetables, like King Oyster Mushrooms, Squash and Onions.  Upon arriving on a Wednesday night for a birthday dinner we were lucky to be immediately seated.  Within just a few minutes, a variety of starters and dipping sauces were delivered and our waitress greeted us with a smile and took our drink order.  The starters included tastings of Kimchi, Noodle Salad, Daikon Radishes, Asian Long Beans and a few other tasty treats. After looking at the menu, and learning you could order three meats at one time and all the vegetables and randoms, we started with the Bulgogi, Shrimp and Spicy Chicken, White Rice, Bone Broth and some vegetables.  With the large group we had we were brought two orders each, thank you to the waitress for knowing the food would go fast.  Having never been the waitress cooked our first round, explaining the timing around each meat as well as the process of cutting into strips...with scissors. Everything was good, but I have to say the Bulgogi and Shrimp stood out for me.  Next round, Beef Tongue, Ribeye Steak and Squid. All I will say is you must try the Beef Tongue! It is sliced paper thin and once placed on the grill cooks pretty quickly and was so fresh, we ended up ordering another round.  In addition to the second round of Beef Tongue we topped off the meal with Button Mushrooms and the Corn Cheese.  Another must try.  Allow the Cheese to heat up and stuff the cooked mushrooms with the Corn Cheese and take a bite, heaven.  Overall, I am not typically a Korean lover, but I enjoyed everything I ate.  In addition, the service was phenomenal and I think it is a great place to enjoy with a group of friends.  So, if you are like me, give it a shot and you will not be disappointed.

630jKEdgfH1kCoReA0E6SA.text: I can't stop going here! The food...Oh my goodness this food is delicious! I love that it is all you can eat and is cooked at the table. Everything I tried was delicious from meat to sauces to what they call ransoms. The price may seem high but is totally worth it. My waitress Jordan was great she cooked everything for me since it was my first time and was very attentive. Come early because the seat fill up quick and parking can be a challenge but believe me when I shout in your ear- "IT IS ALL WORTH IT".

zdaHadw-_W5QhfkMt15oCg.text: I prefer to eat at the kbbq joints in Duluth, GA. However, unless you want to 1) drive to Georgia or 2) cook AND clean a kbbq set-up at home, this is really the only place that you can get your kbbq fixing in Charlotte.    I've only been here once and was not impressed with the quality of meats that were served. The marination of the meats was all too sweet in my opinion, and the marinated meat itself seemed as though they were a few days too old. The plain meats were fine, but unfortunately, you can get better cuts in GA or buy it yourself at a similar price.    All-in-all, the place isn't terrible and the service was good. It's just not my kind of place.   I care a lot about the money value to food quality, and so I've found that I can best utilize those values when I cook kbbq at home instead.

NyF5D27BzudF08NrrENxyQ.text: So this was my first time coming to let's meat! We went on a Sunday night around 6 o'clock and were seated at 6:30. From the reviews and people that have been here, expect to wait. We had a party of 8, and even though we were seated near each other, it wasn't at the same table and both tables had two different servers. Our server was David T. who was very efficient and brought out stuff very quickly. On the other hand, the other table had a women server with half of her head shaved on the side, and our friends were telling us that she was much slower and were forgetting things that they were ordering. So you'll have a different experience by the type of server you'll have. The meat quality is very delicious. The briskets has that perfect marbling, and the pork belly just melts in your mouth. If cooked right, the rib eye steak can be very mouthwatering, but the cuts are very thin and small, so you have to keep an eye on them so they don't overcook. The cheese corn, and egg souffle was really good. But the Bibimbap or "bap bibim" was very saucy as well as the cold noodles. The bone broth is very light but you would have to add salt and pepper to your liking. The oyster king mushrooms are very delicious and I'm not really into mushrooms either.  Our server David mentioned that if we followed their Instagram page and posted a picture on Facebook we would get a dollar discount. It would also count to others who would do it in our party. For example, he said if all eight of us posted or followed the Instagram, we would all get eight dollars off.  Only the manager was able to look at our phones and put it on our receipts. So can you tell me about False advertising, that seven of us did it but we only got 72 cents off? It wasn't even a dollar, and it sounds like it's a big deal, but I mean they lied.... anyway food is good, give it a try,I just got a bad taste in my mouth with the lying advertisement. Also the music is very very loud with 2000s r&b and pop music.

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

RVwx0XUhKp-WTWNq4uM4oA.text: Let's Meat Kbbq is the best place for a fun & tasty experience. I have recently become a huge fan of Korean BBQ places and this has to be top on my list of favorites. We have never been to a place like this before.   Let's Meat is an all you can eat restaurant where you cook in front of yourselves. BE PREPARED TO EAT! Sometimes it scares people to think they have to cook on their own but... Don't worry there are people there to help you along the way!  When you arrive the wait staff will bring out starters/sides like Kimchi, Daikon Radishes, Asian Long Beans and more; along with dipping sauces. Then they will ask you to order your meats/sides. I suggest going in with an open mind and trying everything you can. When I first went I had no idea what half of the food items were, but left loving more than I thought. They offer meat from Bulgogi and Pork Belly to Beef Tongue and Shrimp. They give you rice, but you can also ask for lettuce wraps, which I loved because I could add the meat and some of the starters to it and eat it like a healthy taco. *Side note: I suggest getting the already marinated meats because it makes life easier if you aren't experienced.   My boyfriend and I went together and had a blast. Many people there with us had groups of 4-6. It's a great place for groups, so you can all take turns cooking and eating. Try going at low-traffic times so you don't feel rushed and can just relax and enjoy. They do have a 2 hour limit to the dinning experience, but it does get busy pretty fast!   Overall, Let's Meat is such a fun experience to do for a date night or with a group of people. It is reasonably priced for the amount you eat and experience. It definitely is an experience you won't want to miss. Can't wait to go back next!

photos.caption: Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States

GexYFzvXvfXpc8bf4TxilA.text: Korean BBQ, the way its traditionally enjoyed is not for everyone. Think of fondue but way more involved. I personally went on a Friday evening with a large group of people, early so that we wouldn't have a crazy wait time as its been noted in other reviews. I appreciated that they had a refrigerator with beer and limited wines which you can enjoy while you wait. The menu is very to the point but seems so similar in the choices of meat, that makes it hard to choose but I am a meat lover so I was there to try it all. Our server was particularly great at explaining how it worked and demonstrated how to properly cook certain meats, specifically the pork. Cutting up the meat made it more ideal to not only cook but then share once its been cooked through. There are a ton of side items and hard to figure out which you want to eat with what and then the sauces. I took the approach to try a little of everything. The decor was a large attempt in minimalist and again to the point, nothing to run home about. Very friendly service, food was good but I am not sure I am in a rush to go back. Did it, done it, I am good. Sorry, so much interaction and stimulation overload, pictures were not in favor.

bPH7XXR8L1Q3UPFfN4OT8Q.text: Amazing. Just amazing. I have been to a few Korean BBQ places and this is by far my favorite one! Only thing I did not like was the loud music, but I'm still giving this place 5/5. My favorite meats were the beef brisket and pork belly! Will def come again. 30 bucks per person is a good deal for the quality and fast service we got.

This was one of the best meals I have had in Charlotte in the 20 months I have been coming here for work.  We had most everything on the menu and everything was excellent.  The soy chicken was the best chicken dish and the bulgogi was so good it would turn a vegetarian if they try it.  I LIKE Seoul Food Meat Company, I am in love with Let's Meat Kbbq and will definitely be adding it to the regular rotation and bring a bigger crowd from work next time.

Ld4x_kfaeOWfxYPtoSsjAQ.text: Great service and friendly staff! I love Korean barbaque so this was a great find here in Charlotte! I recommend the ribeye steak, red pepper pork belly, and fatty beef brisket.

OyvgLvPeMjlnXnjYjW3qbQ.text: While I have dined here before and the food has been great, the front desk refuses to manage how they place tables.  I came with a party larger than 6 so we would need two tables.  Initially we were told two hours, thats fine.  There was multiple instances where we could have all sat together but the young kids doing the seating do not know how to hold tables correctly.  There is a two hour time limit on eating here and the staff continued to feed the other table we were waiting on.  The blonde girl who works at the front told my wife for over an hour the table was almost done... which was a lie.  Half of our group was almost done eating by the time we got seated.  I expressed my feelings to the host and didn't even get an I'm sorry.  So much for a nice bday dinner for my wife.

tUsj-oj7C4I2K7Jq_CkQ_g.text: I've been to Korean grill restaurants in Asia and this is the only one in Charlotte that feels the same. Such a fun experience with friends or family. Loved the variety of items to grill. Would've been nice if they had shrimp though.

Apart from the the great service, the prices are reasonable for all you can eat. If you've never had Korean bbq I would definitely recommend it. It's a fun experience for all ages.

UHlhx1sTuYHGAKYT6NY7Lg.text: I was very excited to eat here. Me and my friends have been hyping it up for a few months now. We finally got the chance to go and it was well worth the $30 and the wait. The host were very nice and the waiters were extremely helpful, especially my homies, Carl and Peter. They did a great job of explaining the menu and the whole concept of the restaurant. We started off with some basic meats and later diverged into more random meals. I would greatly recommend anything with beef or pork. All of them were greatly sliced and helped cooked to perfection. The chicken was ehhh. Nothing special just soda normal chicken but not much flavor. The shrimp was underwhelming. A big part that I really enjoyed was both the cow tongue and the buttery squid. The way it was cooked was enjoyable and the end product was pretty good. ALSO THE CORN CHESSE WAS AMAZING! I must've have 5 bowls of it since it was so creamy and delicious. I would greatly recommend this place for a special event and also have 24 hour notice before attending to have space for everything.

Thanks again for making it such a fun night!

KjjrtxmJG0PULhvPg2mt-Q.text: This is probably the only Korean BBQ in Charlotte, which definitely deserves a five star only for this reason.   Take one star out as the selection and taste are not as good as expected, or at least not as good as what a $30-$40 meal should be. Not marinated meat are cut thinly and marinated meat are mini portion and often too sweet. You have to pay extra $14 if you want to have Kalbi.  Service is good, environment is good and clean, a little too loud for me though. There wasn't a wait when we were there on Sunday after 9pm. I would suggest the restaurant to increase their variety of the selections in the menu and possibly take off the extra $$ meat.

NYiyNH3-n-THMWFeki2RNQ.text: So let me tell you a little bit about this restaurant. 6 or more people require you to pay a 18% gratuity. It will be $30 a person, for all you can eat buffet. They will not seat you until everybody arrives. Once you are sitting at the table, you will be able to order 3 meats at a time. They will also tell you that you can cook the food yourself. Now we cooked some of it but we had sever cook most of it because I was like, why am I paying $30 to cook my own food. Do not order more meat than you think you'll be able to eat, because any uncooked meat left, they will add a 10% surcharge to your bill. You can't take any food with you. You'll have two hours to eat, so pace yourself.  In the end, we enjoyed ourselves, and the food was good. The egg souffle is an must try. I mixed my egg souffle with my rice, and also added some of the meats and shrimp.  The miso soup was good as well. It was a little spicy, which I like.  This place will make a perfect spot for a first date because it will allow you to talk with your date while your food is cooking right in front of you.

Photo of Let's Meat Kbbq - Charlotte, NC, United States. You can order 3 meats at a time. Either you can cook it, or the server will. Unlimited food. $30 a person. 2hr max.

jjT5r866MP5CETqaS1Lk8Q.text: Repeatedly ordered: fatty beef brisket, beef tongue, bulbogi, beef chunks, king oyster mushroom (cook it with pork belly), egg souffle, and green leaf lettuce to go with meats. And the sauces needed refills frequently.   Tried some varieties of pork belly. For people who love pork belly, they won't be disappointing. I'm just not a pork belly person.   Loved these Ban Chan (small plates of appetizers): kimchi, potato salad, pickled daikon radish (to go with meats and lettuce leaves)  Only downside: it's so popular that you have to go before 6 to avoid ridiculously long waiting time on the weekdays, and before 4:15 on the weekends (yes, wait in line even before it opens)  Updated on 7/17: The menu has expanded! (See picture)  Tried these new items:     - butter squid: good!     - ribeye: good!     - kimchi noodle soup (cold): not a big fan     - shrimp: good!     - pork belly: original, lemon garlic, garlic and spicy flavors. Like them more than before!      - spicy chicken: good!  Waiting time: recently went on a Sunday and a Tuesday around 5:30. Tuesday: No line during the time while we were there. Sunday: line after 6.

mJsTouePy_HCyGChHY_xug.text: Went here for a date and customer service was spectacular. It does cost a lot, I believe $30 per person and it's worth it depending on how empty your stomach is. I was a little disappointed that some of the food were removed the menu, but overall good food.

sxx4Mp2_i4I1pLUy1q7RDg.text: Give me all the Korean meats please!!! This place is AMAZING!!! I'm sooooo happy we have a KBBQ in Charlotte.  I guess nothing stops ppl from eating KBBQ because it literally looked like a hurricane outside from a storm before we went there and there was still an hour wait for a table.   I had done KBBQ before in other cities  but not like that at Let's Meat. A few of the menu items were foreign to me like the egg souffle, the corn cheese and the beef tongue.  I think my favorite items were the squid, the beef bulgogi and the ribeye. They all had so much flavor and worked well with several of the dipping sauce options. The ribeye was actually magical. I have never had anything like it before.  I wish there was more of a description for some of the Bon Chons. My friend had never done KBBQ before was very curious of some of the items and would not try them because she didn't know what they were and wouldn't ask.  Overall the experience was phenomenal. I think the price is fair and who can turn down such a cool atmosphere and KPOP playing in the background.   Let's Meat KBBQ  1400 S Church St, Ste B,  Charlotte, NC 28203 May 4, 2019 6pm

9IObBHOjxMPHt8FtvL8f7A.text: If you are a personal friend of ours, do not come here. This place is not an authentic Korean food establishment.   An authentic Korean bbq restaurant employees experienced waitstaff who are skilled in the art of grilling. Anyone will tell you, not any can just grill. It's a shame that so many of these restaurants are popping up without maintaining the food standards of the Korean culture.   If you are a local and want to try something new, consider this a great fusion alternative but keep in mind that this is not authentic and be sure to try it again when you visit a more Korean populated city.   We called ahead to see if a la carte was possible and to confirm the two items on the menu. Not only was a la carte not possible, but the host also did not inform us that it would be and additional $14 per order of galbi. For reference, a single order of galbi is meant to serve only a single person. So in order for two people two split more than a meager single serving of galbi, the price would be $90.   At other fine dining Korean restaurants, $90 can go a long way to serve the most premium of beef. All you can eat is already known to serve a far lesser quality of meat in order to compensate for profit. So in conjunction with (1) not a single Korean or even Asian person dining which is a sign that it is not authentic, (2) the host did not inform us correctly of the menu and made us drive out of our way, and (3) the servers were very inexperienced and admitted to not really cooking the food for the customer and telling the customer it's "part of the experience" which is really offensive, we decided not to eat here.    Looks like a lot of people like it here probably because it caters to the demographic, but if you're from out of town and craving Korean bbq as a native, definitely don't come here!  We're giving four stars despite the bad experience to support the local business.

YiDYS45VL4AEFQ0ly67Idg.text: For the price, it's great. Charlotte has been needing a KBBQ or shabu place for a while and this place delivers! I've brought friends and customers here many times and it's always good.   One thing I wish is if they would include the kalbi as an option, 14$/order is a bit much.

EGd9cSpiU2sYfKZHkQSJqg.text: Love love love, this place! You cook your food right in front of you! Delicious food.  A bit on the pricey side ($30 per person and no takeaways).  Highly recommend going  with a group and an open pallet!

J94KhHPlXNnvnODgcThGBw.text: Excellent, fun and great food.  Vin was awesome server.   We waited briefly but went to local pub for a beer.

IWzsqqdb8N4XsKpvqfzsSA.text: I really expected this place to be great, and man was it ever.    We went today with a large group (8 people) and didn't have to wait long for a table, which at 12:00 on a Sunday you never really know how long it'll be.  We were seated and greeted by our server named David, who was great.  He gave us a brief rundown of the menu, and we placed our orders.    We started with the pork belly, and did many orders of that, the beef bulgogi, the ribeye steak and the shrimp.  All of the meats and sauces were absolutely excellent.   You should know that when you go here (as with many Korean BBQ's," you cook the food yourself using the grill in the center of the table and should be comfortable with this going in.    The kimchi and sides they bring for the table pair very well with the meats, and everything brings with it a very complementary flavor.  We were reminded by David that we would be charged for any additional food left over, but rest assured we ate every bite.    It's not a cheap tab ($30 per person for all you can eat,) but well worth it for a treat with a large group.  I would definitely go again.

czQN5r5tbRU2EV-6VcufcA.text: This was not only my first time at this place, but my first experience Korean BBQ! It was during their one year anniversary, so the atmosphere was amazing! Our waiter was super friendly & engaged in conversation with us. He was very thorough with the menu & I felt comfortable with the dining experience because of his assistance.   I don't eat beef or pork but there are seafood and chicken options. If you don't eat meat at all, mushrooms can serve as the protein. The spicy chicken was my favorite & so was the corn and cheese! I got brown rice; it's the sticky kind which was great. They bring out a variety of sauces that you can use for your meat or to use with your rice. I taste tested all of the sauces and they will specifically bring out the sauces you want if you don't want the others. The salad with the house dressing was really good too.   It was perfect timing whenever he would come back to our table asking if we wanted more. I will definitely be back.

Fatty beef brisket was probably my favorite. But they had bologi beef and many others.  The chicken was insane.  There literally was nothing you could complain about.... except maybe the wait, the wait was long but we showed up during peak time and this place is popular.  GO HERE.

un813lL98Mud6h2uuhWsRw.text: Ummm.... yea..... not my cup of tea. The premise is good. There's a place in NY that I love so I was familiar with the concept... but this place really doesn't come close.   It was sooo much work! If you ever thought "what If instead of cooking in the comfort of my home. I'll get little bits of unseasoned meat handed to me by a stranger and try to cook it on a camp fire like thing in the middle of a table in front of my family..." this is the place for you!   It's gonna take just as long if not longer than cooking at home. You just won't have any of the convenience. Then to make matters worse there's no alcohol to at least provide a little buzz while you struggle over the flame.   I only rated this place 3 stars because our server was nice enough to come cook some of the food. Tried the buttered squid and that was the highlight. Everything else was ehhh at best.

HKu_FPlWjdkcp5xt7liQlg.text: $29.99 per adult, the wait time was about 30min for us.  The staff and waiter were real friendly.  They assisted us pretty much from the start to the end even though it wasn't our first time at a KBBQ.  We highly suggest to stick with beef and seafood section mostly for your money's worth.  We were not impressed with pork or chicken but they were decent to try at least once.  Will return again if we are in the area

8B0M4XvS9KtXPcj1M-Nrvw.text: I gave this a solid four star based on the great service.  Our server was awesome, the manager came over and she was awesome, all the staff had great attitudes and were hustling.   On a Thursday night, the place was jamming with great tunes and every table was filled.   The two hour time limit is really no problem, the time goes fast and it doesn't feel rushed.   Actually, the overall experience is sold FIVE star!!!!!  THREE star for value.........One of my good friends is hard core Korean, like off the boat Korean.  We have been to Atlanta a dozen times.   He knows all the mom and pop Korean holes in the wall.   My major issue with this place is the up-charge for the Galbi/Kalbim it is ridiculous.  Furthermore, comparing to other KBBQ I have been too, ummm, around 10 in the last year, all over the USA - this spot has a very limited menu.   Typical of KBBQ, for the same price, but the menu options offer 30-40 varieties.   Like I said, the up-charge really bummed me out, had I known that, I would have skipped this place.   What is offered is excellent and what you would expect from a KBBQ.   I have no problem with the items on the menu, all excellent ---- just the lack of items.    The sides are equally excellent.    If you have never experienced KBBQ, this place should be on your foodie list.  It is a great time and ultra fun to cook your own food.   Don't be intimidated by the method, just jump in or ask a server for help and they will guide you through the process.    Also, if your server is doing everything for you, just tell them that you got it........  They are respectful and not overbearing.

gLrq6QlOSyGmTXtsgL_EoQ.text: On a whim me in the friend decided to check this place out. They don't allow you to be seated without your guest showing up so I think that something to keep in mind.  However coming in for the first time it seems extremely overwhelming. The general concept is you play one set price you can get as many meets as possible. It is nice having the assistant they are to clean off the stove and help guide you along the way. The goal is to be there and eat as much as you want without exceeding your two hour limit.  I fell in love with the bulgogi! I imagine everyone else will as well, what I do when I clicked it is I added pieces of garlic and cooked it all together and it was amazing. We didn't leave with the meat sweats because we also have some of their delicious sides on the side. I would highly recommend cooking the shrimp and seasoning it as well. But it's fun bring a group of friends and have a great moment.

aIEWSYp4WM15YvEEiuzyMA.text: I visited the KBBQ restaurant over the summer, and it was my first time ever having this experience.  Now that I think of it, I think I enjoyed the experience way more than I enjoyed the food.  We made reservations, and it turned out not to be completely necessary as the place wasn't crowded.  Still, I always recommend if you can plan ahead.  Service was kind and efficient and they gladly brought out whatever we needed in a timely way.  Having said that, I found the meat to be fatty for me, and the accompaniments weren't that great.  They gave us a corn and cheese casserole for one of our sides that tasted like can corned sprinkled with cheese.  Also, the meat really stuck to our grill so bad they had to get us another.    It was fun, we had an enjoyable time, but we were hungry later.  I likely won't be back, but know that many there seemed to really enjoy.

I6YvzjL0txagGMSti9FQDw.text: Amazing experience at Let's Meat! Our server, Vien, explained everything to us perfectly once we said it was our first time there. We've been to KBBQ's in other towns but it was our first one in Charlotte. I really liked how he took the time to explain each step to us and his personal recommendations. The meat was amazing and their dipping sauce is scrumptious. Tons of side dishes and it was nice to experiment with all of them. The soju came in a cute gold pot and we got the peach drink to mix it in with, thanks to Vien's recommendation. The cooking area is a little smaller than the other KBBQ's we've been to but I actually like it this way, perfect to enjoy the small portions. Follow them on IG! Apparently if they get 10,000 followers they'll lower the lunch price (according to signs all over the restaurant). I will definitely be returning here!

The one thing I really like was that they have a lot of dipping sauces to change up the flavor of the meats. Probably the biggest disappointment was the salad. It just tasted like lettuce with sesame oil. Overall, if I was in Charlotte and craving some kbbq, this would be the best option, but only because it's the only option.

VEOWC3hnD6PpkUMsAH5Osg.text: With the lack of good Korean BBQ in Columbia, SC., this place is a godsend, even though it's an hour and a half away from me. Service was fantastic and the atmosphere great.  They have a ll the basics as well as some specialties such as pork belly marinated with different sauces/spices. They also have galbi, but it's at an additional cost which kind of sucks... Also, the portions they give the meat at are kind of small, but I get that they're trying to reduce food waste. The great service makes up for it though, as we ordered all that we wanted without waiting much.  It's all-you-can-eat only so be weary of that. If you're in Charlotte and you're hungry, definitely check this place out.

N9qFVI-S4kuSdMY2RemwsA.text: Let's Meat did not disappoint! Totally worth the $30 per person for all you can eat Korean bbq for 2 hours?! Our server Alexandria was wonderful and attentive and so was the rest of the staff! My family and I will definitely be coming back as often as we can! It was such a fun and authentic experience grilling your own meats and vegetables! Definitely get there early so you won't have to wait long! Loved the pork belly, corn cheese, beef tongue was amazing and the beef chucks were definitely my favorite!!! I didn't take any pictures of the meat on the grill because I was wayyyyy to excited and busy enjoying the great food! The sides were awesome delicious! Awesome kimchi, salad, pickled veggies and a great selection of sauces! If you love Korean food come to Let's Meat, it is definitely going to be one of Charlotte's best restaurants!

4UPj69IPjT0iAs81NefsUQ.text: I had some friends in town from Philadelphia who were in the mood for Korean BBQ.  Being vegan, I wasn't too thrilled about it, but I took one for the team and went along for the ride.  I figured worst case scenario I could munch on mushrooms, kimchi, and rice.  We were seated and ordered rounds of soju and beer and everything was going scrumtralescently.  Then it happened.  The meats arrived.  I had Vietnam flashbacks.   My pupils dilated.  I tried my best to think happy thoughts, but once my friends put the meat on the grill, the most overwhelmingly insatiable desire to take part in the meat-eating overtook me.  I thought back on all the animals I hadn't eaten over the past few years.  I looked at the meat searing on the grill.  I looked up, hoping god would intervene.  There was no god.  I took my chopsticks and went for a piece of beef tongue on the grill.  The conversation my friends were having was no more.  All eyes were on me.  I grasped the beef tongue between my sticks, dipped it in some garlic chili sauce, and brought it to my mouth.  "This is the moment of truth," everyone was thinking.  I deposited it in my oral orifice.  My taste buds celebrated the long forgotten taste of meat the way the Cubs fans did when they won the series after 100 years.  It was like every episode of Shokugeki no Soma combined.  Dopamine flooded my brain.  I had a massive erection.  I experienced the most intense euphoria of my life.  This was the meat injection that would satisfy any trainspotter.  After I was done chewing and swallowed, the silence that had blanketed the table was replaced by the loud roar of not only my friends cheering, but the adjacent tables and nearby employees cheering as well.  I felt like I had just single-handedly defeated the 3rd reich.  One kind stranger bought soju for our entire table and made a toast in my honor.  I gorged on delicious meats throughout the night.  I had never been so happy.  Thank you, Let's Meat, for showing me the light.  I shall return.

FAfPpU6KkewZJ3SZdjFJTA.text: Had a great experience here on thanksgiving day! Service was fast and friendly despite it being a very busy day (and props to them for opening on a holiday). The meat and side dishes were very fresh and flavorful. Also a very good array of banchan (Korean side dishes). Price is a bit more expensive than I'm used to ($30) but I think the service makes up for it. If you want any specific vegetable or side items, the server will be happy to bring you extra (I got a plate of onions and garlic because what else is better with beef than caramel iced onions?).

74cgeqHuP2lNZzIIyl3VNA.text: Let's Meat is a GO-TO when talking about Korean BBQ. The wait staff is attentive and prompt when the need arises.  Service was seamless and we were attended by no less than 8 staff members!  We literally wanted for nothing! Good variety of meats making Let's Meat a definite must eat.    When to get there= EARLY!!! (opens at 430 and fills up quickly) Where to wait= their sister restaurant on the same property has a nice patio bar and they'll call you when your table is ready. What to order= Lemon Pork belly & Bulgogi act as co-stars of the show.  Don't forget to order a few sides of veggies...  I find it best to place the veggies around the perimeter of the grill, place a few pieces of pork belly near the center;  allowing them to crackle, smoke and sear accordingly- the beautiful juices flow down onto the veggies & help cook them.

_RtjfHxMPQ039IiyG0xFLw.text: i'm so glad i don't have to drive all the way to georgia to satisfy my korean bbq cravings! it was delicious! although, our waitress kept recommending how we should cook our meat and just tossed random things into the grill lol then she kept telling us the tongue was what the pork belly was and it was her favorite... mhm, ok haha could use more than 5 minutes for our group to just relax and eat without constantly, very constantly being checked on, but i'm sure she meant nothing by it. definitely recommend this place to everyone though.

JiTfbb3F7sZlEzZdGo4o3A.text: The service is great. Friendly and fun staff. The manager is very nice and accommodating. Usually at ayce kbbq places the steam egg is funky and watery and weird, but this place is different and the steam egg is smooth and creamy without smelling weird and being watery. I love the brisket here. In my opinion, brisket is the staple of ayce kbbq and if your brisket is good quality, then you've basically nailed the kbbq business. I love the garlic lemon pepper pork belly. They have so many meat options for their ayce and I think it's so worthy for the price. Of course you can go to more Korean-cultured cities and find cheaper ayce kbbq, but the quality is another question. The quality and price at Let's Meat is a good deal to me. However, the only thing I don't like about this place is the side dishes. They're very mediocre at best. I would like to see better kimchi and sprouts.

wI3SvNcUGO9COQ6dmyg5Jw.text: Excellent! 5 Star! Love the selction and highly recommend the bull-go-gi!!!! Come with a group or a couple and settle in for a treat.   Note: parking is hard to come by but worth the hunt.

oQhHzfuzhj8XU5zpeGX-yA.text: A fantastic culinary experience!  Great food and a really cool place. You order unlimited meat and cool it yourself on the grill. This place really exceeded my expectations.  We sat down at a table with a small grill in the center and felt a little overwhelmed. I had eaten Korean BBQ before but never the tradition grill-your-own meat type of place. Our server quickly realized we didn't know what to do and helped us get started. You can order 3 meats at a time - several times of pork belly and other pork, some cuts of beef, some chicken, seafood and a few other options. After our first round, we started to get a hang of it and wanted to try everything the menu had to offer.   It was unanimous at our table, bulgogi is delicious in general but it's even better when you grill it yourself at. your table. Mix it with a really cool atmosphere and a dining an exciting dining experience that is unique in the Charlotte area and you've got yourself an easy 5 star night out

uaoywAW6LXrXHztxEPirRw.text: Great. I am excited to see what other meats will join the menu as they grow. The wait was long but worth it. I wasn't greeted when I came in and I had to figure out on my own that there is a list up front with an eraseable marker to write my name and phone number on. I didn't find this method very effective and hope they find a more efficient one. I would recommend arriving at a decent time. At a certain point they have to cut off any other customers that come in due to the nature of the restaurant offering all you can eat for 2 hours.  The dipping sauces were good. The house sauce is the best. Then you have sesame oil and hot dipping sauce and paste. A large variety of sides included. I tried all of the beef, pork belly, and chicken. We also got the kalbi which is extra. It was so tasty that we considered it the dessert for the night.  Generous portions as well as all you can eat sides. We got an extremely nice waitress. Since we were one of the last people sat, she gave us a lot of attention and cooked our meats for us since we were her only table. Traditionally you are supposed to cook your own meat so they may not do this on a busier night.  Overall it was a decent experience. I'd like to see some Kobe or wagyu added to make things even more interesting. The atmosphere was a little loud as large parties were drinking. The music was a little out of place since it was almost like electronic or club music. Something more traditional would add to the experience.

s4vFRJIoIT6Ehvy5TVtJnQ.text: I took my fiance here last night for his birthday dinner and it was absolutely amazing! Unfortunately we didn't plan well - and since we went on a Saturday night and they don't take reservations so we ended up waiting almost 2 hours for a table. I typically wouldn't wait this long, but our friends told us how amazing it is. So we waited and went next door to grab a drink. As soon as we were seated our waiter was there to explain the process and answer any and all of our questions. We were able to order 3 meats at a time and unlimited sides and vegetables. The food came out within minutes and we were able to start cooking. Our waiter came back to our table multiple times throughout the night and we never felt like we were waiting for him to explain something or bring over more food - if anything we had too much food! The star of the night is the beef bulgogi. We loved it so much we ordered it twice! We also tried the squid which I didn't love (seeing tentacles freaks me out a bit) but my fiance liked it. We also tried the tongue which I told the waiter I probably wouldn't try - I was imagining a full giant tongue to come out, but to my surprise it was thinly sliced meat that didn't resemble a tongue at all. Once cooked it tasted similar to meat you would get on a cheesesteak. It wasn't amazing, but I'm glad I took the opportunity to try something new. Overall we loved everything about this place (except the wait)! While we were sitting there we were already planning on bringing our friends back here with us. My only hope is that in the future they start to take reservations or use the no wait app.

IxzpNvDyVqfUfKR-stmEBg.text: I've been dying to try this place out and it finally happened. I've read so many reviews and have friends saying good things about this place that I had to check it out. The wait is kind long so my husband and I decided to go early.  We got there around 6:30 and were advise the wait would take around 45 minutes. I was wondering how long the wait is if you get there around 7:30ish??? Probably over an hour but I can tell you in advance that it is totally worth it! The good thing is they get your number and call when your table is ready so you don't have to wait there.  In the waiting area they have a big screen that explain how everything works and it is pretty easy actually.  Our table was ready for us around 30 minutes after our arrival.  Our waiter Zach was really nice and helpful. He explain how everything worked and made suggestions about the menu.  I had a Korean grape juice that was delicious and we had many different kinds of meat that night.  Our favorite was beef brisket! The place was clean, the service was really good, the food did not take long to get to us and is all you can eat, so if you love good food like us this is the place for you!  They have a two hour limit once you order but you will be done probably before that. Love the place, love the food. Can't wait to go back! !!!
