0U8GHjqq-EhDdCulzLlESA.text: So it looks like Charlotte finally got Korean BBQ, and it's about time.  If you have no idea what KBBQ is, it's basically a hot pot but for grilled meat. If you don't know what Hot Pot is, think of a do it yourself BBQ. When I'm talking about DIY BBQ, I mean, they give you raw meat and you put it on the grill and you bbq for yourself. I think Let's Meat is actually doing it right in a new market though. However saying that, I do think that there are some things that they still have to iron out.  First up, getting seated. We're standing in line waiting for a table, and we know that we have 2 people coming along however we're already there and want to sit down. Instead of waiting for the whole party to be there, let us get seated, because what if the tables fill up? I get it, the 2-hour time limit once you sit down starts as soon as we get seated and it wouldn't be fair for those who come along after. I can see that if it gets really busy and there's only one person with a party of 6, yeah okay, I guess because the restaurant wants to maximize profits. But, if a majority of the party shows up why can't they sit? Start the time, and kick them out at 2 hours whether or not all of them are there or not, it's not the staff's fault for their party not being there on time. Plus, the BBQ portion still takes time to cook anyways so that gives it more reason to just seat those that are there already.  I do think that the staff is doing an excellent job on educating people on what KBBQ is. Especially in this market, there are those that have no idea what it is and could feel intimidated especially coming from an environment when everything is already done when served. I thought our waiter was amazing at explaining and demonstrating how to cook/kbbq. Even though he didn't need to, I think he was in the mode of explaining so I just let him do his script that he basically came up with from serving X amount of tables.   **When ordering: PORK BELLY IS 1 PIECE per ORDER.** My experiences in KBBQ usually 1 order is like 3 pieces or sometimes 4. However, Let's Meat speaks a different language. One order of let's say pork belly, means literally, one piece. So if you're thinking oh, let's get X amount of pork belly, just order the amount. For beef brisket, it's really thin so don't feel bad for thinking you're "over ordering."  I think that didn't come out until I ordered. If I would have known I would've ordered 5-6 orders of pork belly from the start.  Sauces: Let's Meat comes up a little short on this. We asked simply for some soy sauce to dip our meat into, and the staff responded that they didn't have any. But, when they served the side dishes, guess what one of those dishes had? Yeah, soy sauce. So, if you don't have any soy sauce, how? So, if you're looking to want to dip your meats into something, I would definitely recommend you to bring your own sauce in. They don't judge or say you can't, so that's definitely a tip on that end. Now, please don't bring in like A1 or Ketchup to dip your KBBQ meat in, I'm talking on the realm of fish sauce, or chili sauce that you want to dip.  Alcoholic Beverages: Let's Meat has them. If you've never had flavored Soju...you're in for a treat if you go down that route. Just drink responsibly, because most likely you won't know what hit you until you stand up.  Time Limit: 2 hours is technically plenty of time to eat. If you're worried about that, order more at the beginning so you have it cooking. However, this is one limitation that affected me because even though I know 2 hours is plenty of time, it still gives me anxiety when I'm eating and I just don't like that feeling. In my experience at other KBBQ restaurants, I don't really think about time and in the back of my mind repeating: "We have to eat faster and order more or they'll kick us out!" I know we were done within the 2 hours, but still I think this would be my biggest hesitation on coming here to eat again.  Overall: Let's Meat isn't bad. The price point of $29.99 per person, and depending on what you order it could be more. We ordered the Kalbi, because I mean, that's what you should get, at least to try out. If you don't know what it is, let's just say it's on the sweet side, but it's really tasty and can become dangerous to increasing that bill. Still if you've never had it, it's something to get. I would definitely come back when the market of KBBQ settles down a bit. But if you have never been here and you want to know what the hype is about, go for it because it's not 4 hours away like it used to be when I grew up and lived in Charlotte.

g1k-a0leCTHcCBpn7FLTcQ.text: Everyone needs to come here! Such an incredible blend of spices and flavors and meats you don't get bored eating!! Xavier is THE best server we have ever had and will 100000% be coming back not just for the food but for him and his incredible service!!

wB6eJqRVz-ysxQuzwWSQRQ.text: Came for a second time today and it wasn't even a weekend and it was pretty busy! THEY ADDED MORE OPTIONS TO THEIR MENU!!!   The seafood options are on point, and the squid is extremely fresh. My family loved the squid and we ordered multiple rounds. Their marination for the beef still amazes me, as it is so well seasoned. I wish some of the pork belly options had a more strong flavor from the marination. It's very subtle and a stronger sense of flavor would be awesome.   I can't wait to see what new options they'll be adding to their menu! A spicy squid option would be pretty dank... Whatever they choose to add, I'm sure it won't disappoint!   Our waiter was so sweet and quick on his feet. The staff is amazing and I think why everything works so well is because they have such a good sense of teamwork in this place. Keep it up!!

hCNm787LOFpIwRkDjP0E5Q.text: I've gone back and forth on whether I want to give this place a 3 or 4 star review so I'll probably just let it fall on the high side of a 3.5 and round up to 4. When we got there on a Friday night we surprisingly didn't have to wait even though we were a party of six. It's very loud and overwhelming when you first come in and sit down with your waiter giving you a quick explanation, asking for drinks, and what meat you want to start with. You can choose 3 meats at a time and bless our waiter for giving us double the meat servings with each order, we were a party of 6 with 4 large ex-football players who can eat. The fun part was trying all the different kinds of meat and our favorite was the bulgogi. It was delicious and the first time most of us had it. The person in the middle got stuck cooking most of everything so be forewarned, pick your seat wisely! It was a bit frantic at first with just rapidly cooking but once we started to get more full it slowed down and became more fun. Now that we've been there I probably don't need to rush back due to the cost but it was fun for to show visitors.

pRSPEUkZMkfx6JZE92ysNQ.text: This place was Ssssooooo close to getting one star. So close. I've had Korean bbq in several bigs cities - Chi-town, NYC, ATL... I may not be Korean but I'm a pretty good judge of food so i know good Korean BBQ. The risk of one star had absolutely nothing to do with the food or waitstaff - it's all due to the seating arranged by the hostess.   Came here on a Friday night around 5:30 with a party of 14. We were told It would be 40-45 min wait. The hostess pointed out two tables in the front and said that would be ours. We put down our name and headed next door to Seoul for beers while we wait. 30 min later, we check with the hostess and was told it's another 40 min wait again. No reasoning, no explanation. We glanced over at the tables that were supposed to be ours and noticed there's two new sets of customers seated there. Wait - did you just give our tables to someone else? And failed to update us? When we realized that, we went back to the hostess and was told those two tables couldn't accommodate 14 people so they had to change the plan. I was beyond livid. Why were we told one thing and not updated when the plan changed? At this point it's been an hour and a half wait. I don't mind waiting but when you're told 40 min and it's been 90 min, something's gotta give. Because we already invested so much time - not to mention we're here to celebrate my 18 year wedding anniversary - we decided to continue to wait. Luckily our name was called about 5 min after the showdown with the hostess.   We get to our seat and it's three tables. Our friends visiting from MN were on the opposite side so there was absolutely no interaction with them during the meal. Another negative.   Now on to the food. As soon as we sat down, someone came by to take drink orders and the ban chan (side dishes) were dropped off. Before our waters were even given, another person (our waiter) came by to take our food orders and It went uphill from there. I'm talking from a 1 star to a full 5 stars right away.   All of the side dishes were delicious. The meats were so flavorful- definitely the best bulgolgi I've ever had. Packed with flavor. The dipping sauces were plentiful and on point. Try the corn cheese. I know It sounds weird but there's something about gooey mozzarella cheese melted over sweet corn that paired together so well. Who would've thunk It? My 10 year old nephew has to be the pickiest eater alive. He eats a total of 6 things in the world- rice and chicken, rice and eggs, pizza, nachos, cheeseburger and nuggets with fries. That's It. I was not looking forward to paying $12 for nothing but surprisingly, I gave him chunks of pork belly crisped up on the grill over a bowl of rice and he rated It 10 out of 10. That's saying a lot!!!   Let's talk about the service for a minute. Can I give them 5 stars too? I mean, my table consisted of 6 people, 3 of which we're guys over 200 lbs each. And we stayed taken care of. Ask for more rice? You get it right away. You didn't even have to ask for drink refills, you automatically get a glass that's kept full. No matter how many times we asked for additional items, everyone stayed friendly and obliging. Our waitress Camilla must be an angel sent from heaven cause she put up with our neediness with a smile fixed on her face. Gratuity was included in our bill but each of our three tables gave more tips on top of It because our wait staff was impeccable. Then at the end of our meal, the manager or owner walked around and talked to us. Man I wish every place was like this. They have seriously ruined me for customer service anywhere else. All in all, even though we had issues with the hostess and the wait time, we will definitely be regulars here. Just not with a large party again.   Thank you Let's Meat for putting Charlotte on the map when It comes to Korean bbq. You did not disappoint!

fl8-qWIPAh8VIrANIE3T4A.text: Exactly what Charlotte has been needing!  I could not wait to until this place opened and made sure I was there on their grand opening.  Located right beside Soul Meat, the parking I can see being an issue on the weekends when they are probably the busiest but there seems to be a lot of street parking.  Once the doors were finally open for business, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. Giving out menus to review before we were seated and answering questions. Even though it was grand opening day it was not overcrowded and we did not have to wait for a table. There are plenty of tables and many are able to accommodate large parties which is great.  Once we were seated at our table our grill was immediately lighted by one of the staff and our server came over to explain the process and start putting in orders for our table. We received all Banchans (side dishes) that are used in Korean BBQ and all of them were fresh and tasted amazing. At $30 a hour per person, we ordered almost every meat on the menu. Don't let the $30 a hour per person discourage or alarm you. I have been to authentic Korean restaurants in Korea and a few in the States and this is probably the best deal because ordering a la carte at other restaurants can really start adding up and kind of leave you still feeling hungry.  Our favorite meats we ordered was the Pork belly, thin and original and the fatty beef brisket. We ordered the spicy chicken but we did not really enjoy it, it was a little too spicy and really no flavor besides that. We loved having both options of rice and lettuce to eat with our meat and side dishes. I don't believe we even got close to the 2 hour limit, we probably only ate for a hour because the serve was so great. We always quickly received our new order of meat for the grill and side dishes.  Having been to Korea and trying to find a restaurant that was similar to the authentic Korean BBQ we had in Korea, Let's Meat by far has been the closest thing to what we had in Korea. The concept of cooking your own food and ordering what you like for a flat rate I'm sure will be very popular as the word gets out about the restaurant.

Pd2VwDaZDWB64i72V44yyQ.text: This was my first Korean BBQ experience. I had an amazing time. We chose to go on an off peak time (6 PM on a Monday) to avoid waiting. We were seated immediately and the server came over within 3 minutes. They have several meat options. Be sure to glance over the house rules to ensure no surprises. You can cook the meat or allow the server to cook for you. We opted for them to do so. Awesome experience! It's a 2 hour maximum so order wisely.

P9bBG5nZmgC1bedNuCnwVA.text: This was absolutely amazing! I love good Korean BBQ, and this definitely surpassed my expectations!

GUGcH3OOyKj6aTn_uqXDXQ.text: Great food and service! The ambiance is a similar to a loud cafeteria but you'll get used to it.

fWN3fRCtq4a2b09oeJQgkw.text: This place is overrated.  I think most charlottes have never had Korean bbq before.  It's below average quality in Asia.  And they trick the customers by controlling space of ordering.  It's not all you can eat at all.

PXNaMbfLHeZZbxO8xjo-wA.text: OMG!!!! Sooooo....I ate here for dinner with my family. It was AMAZING!!!! Great service and great food. Our server Zack was great. Very helpful. Can't wait till our next visit.

QF43iTwLjvIHAlir3gH0Bw.text: I love Korean bbq! And when I want it I would have to drive to GA for it because of the big Korean Community. So I was super excited this place opened in Charlotte. It's $30 person all you can eat for 2hrs. But I was disappointed. For $30, I wanted some seafood and more cuts of meat. All that was on the menu was beef and pork and 1 chicken option. Pork belly marinated in different sauce were mostly the choices. The veggie plate came with only 3 kinds of veggie: onion, zucchini,and carrots. Little side dishes were ok only  but I loved the salad. I probably won't return. But if you like to experienced Korean bbq with the drive to GA. Give it a go.

ZOCyMDtDLhjipexF_wcJ9A.text: Great place! Our server was knowledgeable and attentive, explained the menu very well and talked us through all of our options. We liked the soy chicken and the brisket the best, the egg souffle side was also really really good. Make sure you eat what you have before you order more, you'd be surprised how full you get while eating in between orders! Definitely a place you go to eat at knowing you and your food baby won't be leaving the couch for the rest of the day!

XKQb00-iriSyS45qaCrD8g.text: Kara was phenomenal as a manager.. attentive and customer oriented - a servant leader and engaging person.  Our server Vishal was fantastic!  This place is an absolute must visit.  There food is scrumptious and service is stellar.  I highly recommend this restaurant.., it's a five star experience.

hAurISa_j7fI_v_mu1calw.text: Came here to visit my friend that's staying in Charlotte and we came here after she picked me up from the airport. We were really hungry and was excited that the fact that this place was all you can eat! The place itself is pretty cute and the staff there was really friendly and nice. Our waiter was super nice and gave us recommendations and explained the menu for us. The menu doesn't have a lot of options but the portions were fairly big. When it comes to BBQ, you can't go wrong with beef tongue, pork belly, fatty beef, and bulgogi! The price wasn't bad either and it was a pretty fair price compared to paying for individual dishes. Drinks were fairly cheap and if you you're alcohol tolerance is pretty low like mine, best choice is makgeolli, which is Korean rice wine, and peach flavor makgeolli is the best to go. The noice level was average, mostly listening to EDM music and some hip hop the most. It was hard to listen to my friend's conversation but honestly they got a good music playlist. I would recommend people coming here for lunch and dinner. I would definitely come back here to Charlotte when I take another spontaneous trip!

cAKkXNT0Rg7x1NJiX1utBQ.text: Delish. Do wish waiters would slow down a bit, but food delish!! Order lettuce leaves and make everything a lettuce wrap w rice, Meat, sauce and "relish" stuff...yummy!!

1Iv_UocRYix1z3uddePE7w.text: First time there. Don't remember the servers name but he was great. Wait was a little long but definitely worth it.

oOONOmihrPywU5tDjIOKCA.text: This is my absolute favorite Korean BBQ! The food was delicious and there are several choices to chose from! They are very friendly and the waiters are extremely kind and helpful to those who are new to the Korean BBQ! I will definitely be back!

EDxHPyDdUN9ShPBT_Sg9Kw.text: I love this restaurant, although the wait on the weekends are pretty long, it's so worth it! The staff are so friendly and check on you all the time! The food is great and comes in small convenient portions so you don't get full fast! My waiter's name was Green! He was so nice and informed us on how the menu worked! I 100% will be returning!

B-ml9aZnQCSVmWqC-qeENQ.text: So thrilled to finally have Korean BBQ in Charlotte! We had an amazing time at let's meat! The waiters for so attentive and helpful. The owner was walking around the restaurant as well engaging in conversation and helping bbq the meat! We loved everything but our favorites were the beef bulgogi and the beef chunks! This is one place that I will continue to come to over and over again!

htoMC5GD_MtAYC-r8e0qjw.text: Incredible food and experience. Highly recommend. Especially loved the beef and pork bulgogi, spicy chicken and the shrimp.

QzHd-qNfQu84kNZ56yb-TQ.text: This restaurant would be better if their staff had better customer service training. The hostess/cashier (the Korean one with the chubby cheeks) made me want to leave as soon as I walked in. NOT someone you want greeting your first-time customers! I walked in with two small children (ages 3 and 7) and my 84 year old grandmother to get a table while my sister parked the car. When I requested a table for five, she tells us she will seat us as soon as the fifth person comes in. We ask why we can't just be seated now, that the other person will be in shortly, and she tells "Ok, but we'll start your clock for 2 hours". Seriously? What is this, a buffet?? Even if we were seated without the rest of our party being there, we would need a few minutes to look at the menu, the order to come out, and the food to cook so that would cut into our time anyway. What she said and especially HOW she said it was completely unnecessary and only turned us off from wanting to eat there. We wouldn't stuff our faces for 2 hours ANYWAY! It doesnt matter how good the food is (which was average, btw) if the staff sucks. People want to go where they feel welcome! I'd give zero stars if I could.

RDEt2t7aSTHoYueJGELOIg.text: I really loved this place! They had helpful servers, and really nice owners who came by to check on us. The food was very good and authentic. I am looking forward to going back. They're off to a great start!

8mYiX8jTNKLuEWGQAbVp2Q.text: We went on Sunday. It was a pretty long wait but we thought it was definitely worth it. The beef was great and all the sides were delicious. Server checked on us and kept bringing what we needed. Definitely will be back!

PybPME49RWpCY1F-f2ci4w.text: Went on a Friday night with a group of nine; couple of people were running late so we waited at the bar for a few drinks. I accidentally spilled a full drink all over the counter and floor , but hostess was super cool and laughed it off. That was a good example of the kind of service this place has; everyone is super chill and on top of it. After we were seated, we ordered the large prime beef combo , the large marinated beef combo, as well as a chicken and shrimp (one of our friends doesn't eat red meat). The food was amazing! I'd gone to Jongro with my wife the weekend before, and while I'd say that the beef there was a little higher quality, let's meat was definitely in the ballpark. Also the vibe was great; clean, lots of energy but not pretentious at all. We kept on ordering drinks (2 bottles of wine, some beers and a bottle of Soju), and the waiters comped us a free entree because one of the bottles we wanted wasn't available! It was a marinated pork  and tofu dish and it was amazing as well. Overall, we ended up staying for about three hours, and it cost ~$70/head with all of that food and drink (which is actually really good for nyc). Highly recommend; if you're looking for high quality Korean BBQ without the wait it should definitely be on your short list of places in the city to go.
